description:
I've walked into this restaurant a few times over the years as it is in the theater district of San Francisco's Union Square and it offers a very excellent menu tasty food and dishes at decent prices for that part of town 

I enjoyed the fried rice with chicken and in the past have had some of the other Vietnamese dishes that are all excellent 

staff is friendly parking is not easy it is in downtown area so it's only garages maybe some street parking and of course public transportation is the easiest way to use this restaurant as it is just one block from Powell Street BART station I highly recommend this restaurant
author: Vince V.

description:
Food was just okay. Service was horrible! We LOVE Thai food so was disappointed with the result of this place! We walked in, and sat down right away but was greated by our server after a good 10mins. Keep in mind there were only 7 tables at that moment. 

After the server appeared we ordered. We asked for a soup and two entrees and two glasses of water. We waited close to 10 and then had to ask the waitress twice for the water. Which she then brought to us in plastic cups, as she said they ran out of glasses. That was confusing as there were literally 7 tables seated in the whole place?!? 

 We started with The soup, Tom Yum Gai, good tasting and the right amount of mushrooms and onions.  And then We ordered the Pad Prik King which is one of our favorites. It was good, flavorful and had just the right amount of spice. Our second dish, the Pad See Ewi was soooo bland. Lacked flavor and appeal. 

Needless to say we won't be returning back. We were not impressed with the dishes or the plastic cups.
author: Bill F.

description:
Food is good. Service is good. Lots of customers. 

My husband and I were going to Kin Khao but it's an hour wait and the bar was on waiting list as well. They don't do take out either. So went walked across the street and there The Old Siam. 

We chucked down four dishes and some beer. We had Pad Thai, Lemongrass chicken, fish cake, and chicken satay. All very good. 

We went back today and had siam wings, special thai noodles, and pineapple fried rice. All very good as well. 

Totally recommend!
author: Vivian L.

description: We were there because the Kin Khao across the street has a long line and we can't wait to have dinner. Overall, the service was horrible. One piece of the tomato in the soup still had its price tag on while being served. It was disgusting but what's worse is that when we confront the waitress and she responded that "you have already eating the soup" and was reluctant to re-make it. They then re-made the soup at our insistence. We paid 18% tips and wasn't willing to go back again.
author: Yanzhong L.

description:
We were craving Thai and we just got done shopping so we relied on the friendly Yelp to help us feed our cravings. We stumbled upon The Old Siam and were kind of skeptical because of the reviews but the menu items looked pretty good, so we gave it a whirl.

When we arrived there was a 10-15 minute wait for 2 and the wait time went by fairly quick. The restaurant looks bigger than it is but still pretty small. It's right across the street from Park 55.

Service was decent. The water is is served without ice so if you want ice you need to request for ice with your water. The food was mediocre. I ordered the beef pad se-ew and it tasted bland. I had to add A LOT of red sauce because I like my food spicy but I can't fault them for that. All in all mediocre Thai and cheap too!
author: Trinh V.

description: Great spot! Recommend the pad see ew beef, sweet chicken or friend chicken (katsu). The yellow curry is good. Those are my preferences but they have a lot of good dishes.
author: Kyle P.

description:
Really solid Thai food. It was not as busy as I thought for a work week lunch rush. Food came out quick, tasted delicious, and good service. What more can you ask?

Pineapple Fried Rice did not have a lot of pineapples, which I liked. They did not skimp out on the chicken either. I definitely would recommend it.
author: Geoffrey C.

description:
My friends and I were craving Thai food at the time (well more like I was) and this restaurant happened to be in the area so we decided to stop n and try it.

I ended up getting the Pad Kee Mao here and it wasn't all that good. It lacked the nice rich flavor that a Pad Kee Mao has, and ended up coming off a little boring. The noodles were cooked okay, they were well cooked in some parts but had gotten a little broken in others. The overall seasoning and toppings though were my main gripe with this dish.

I also tried my friends Pad Thai and it ended up tasting really sweet and quite lacking in depth.

Overall a pass, I feel there are better choices in San Francisco.
author: Tyler T.

description:
The Food
I ordered the Thai Tradition Noodle Soup, there's nothing wrong with the noodles, the meat and the vegetables it was just the broth that tasted a bit weird. It kinda smells in a bad way but I'm​ guessing ​that it is the traditional taste or smell of their noodle broth. 

The Place
The place is medium. I went there on weekends and I waited for 15 minutes for a table

The Service
The staffs were okay.

Overall
Not sure if I would come back here but If I was really hungry and this is the closest restaurant, wouldn't​ hurt to try their other menu.
author: Cindy W.

description:
The thai tea is very sweet but delicious!

I ordered chicken pad thai and it was really good, I enjoyed it a lot. I wish it had more peanuts in it though! 

No wait, very clean, LOVE the pricing more than anything. Pad thai was $12 which is fair for downtown SF! And the thai tea was $3 and change. My whole meal was $16.  :) 

would come back again!
author: Noorafi A.

description:
Came here for a late lunch with two people who had never had Thai food before. They left not hating Thai food, so that must mean something! This is definitely a solid Thai restaurant with a good amount of options. The servers were also nice and answered any questions I had. 

I enjoyed their lunch combo and appreciated all the different options that were available. Thought it was choose fried rice or pad thai, but it comes with both! That was pretty cool. 

My favorite was probably their Tom Kha soup. It was a good blend of tangy and coconut flavors. 

Between the two desserts, mango with sticky rice was definitely the winner. The mango was AMAZINGLY ripe and would melt in your mouth right away. Combined with the sticky rice, it was unbeatable.
author: Christine L.

description:
This is one of my go-to's when I want a hot lunch. Service is prompt and courteous when I go there. I'm a regular here with my fellow coworker and we've noticed this one woman who works here and we don't know why. She obviously hates working here and her face shows it every time we see her. We've come up with some possible reasons: she's the owner's daughter, she doesn't want to look for another job, she's just a miserable, unhappy person. Some of my favorites are their combination plates that are available from 11:00-5:00 for $11.95 (+ $2.99 if you include soup to your lunch) and the duck fried rice which is pretty generous with duck. When I've ordered the combination lunch, I've gotten the fried egg rolls, fried tofu, chicken satay, barbecued chicken, chicken krapaw, curry chicken, all delicious, never disappointed.
* Today I was served water, which I drank from, in a filthy glass. I didn't realize how filthy it was until I lowered the water level by drinking from it. It had an oily film on the inside, obviously not washed. I'm having some reservations about eating here from now on. I didn't even get an apology. I should've walked out.
author: Kim L.

description:
Came here for lunch. Decided not to order off the lunch special seeing I wanted to know if this place had better Larb & Tom Kha Gai. 

Tom Kha Gai which is Sliced chicken in coconut soup with galangal, lemongrass, mushroom and onions, was definitely on point. I was able to get a half order so I could enjoy other things. I really enjoy this soup. It is one of my favorite Thai foods.

The Larb which is a choice of ground pork, beef or chicken tossed with red onion, green onion, cilantro and special lime sauce. I chose the pork. I was ok, not the best I've had, not the worst. Seams to lack some flavor. 

The Thai coffee on the other hand was spot on. Full of flavor and just the right amount of caffeine kick. Would definitely go back for one. 

Service was good and very friendly. No wait to be seated and food came out fast.
author: Brandon L.

description: Worst experience seriously. I have never had this kind of bullshit receipt before. Their service wasn't good also foods were bad but they forced a 18% of gratuity on us. Okay, so far, I can try to understand it. BUT, the most ridiculous thing was they actually calculate a tax includes a tip into total amount of items. Why should I pay a tax of tip???? I know there's only $1 of difference, but I don't want to pay a tax of tip. And we complained about that, but all the servers pretended like they don't understand!!! I felt like they are thinking we complain about this to avoid tipping. Anyway, it was so bad. Terrible experience. We just waste our $66. Also, they will ask you additional tip on a final receipt. Be careful.
author: Suna Y.

description: I was craving for Thai food and this was very close to our hotel. Restaurant was busy when we arrived but wait wasn't that long. Everything we ordered was just okay, nothing stood out.
author: Stephanie C.

description:
Place - It is easy to find. There are lots of tables inside. Good for large group. Clean interior. 

Taste - I ordered a wanton soup and lunch menu. 

* Wanton soup - I thought it is wantin noddle soup but it was just wanton soup. There were avfew wantons, a few vegies and few meat. The amount was too small. My boyfriend ordered it and ate all for few minutes. If u want a meal, it will be better to order wanton noddle soup. 

Taste was soso. Nothing special. The quality of wanton and soup was not really good. 

* Lunch combo -Lunch combo was btw 11am to 5pm. I could choose one appiti and meat. It came with egg fried rice and noddle. I picked chicken satay and pad kraw(beef). The dish was good! Especially, chicken satay was greally good. Others were also good but overall little salty.

Service and Price - Service was good but little slow. Price was reasonable.
author: Da Won L.

description:
A SOLID choice for Thai food. This place has never failed me - and I don't expect it to.
Excellent portioning and quick service.
Great for groups and last minute decision making while trying to find a place in the City!
Still close to Union Square and Bart.
Pretty convenient location.
author: Anisa A.

description: I lived in Thailand for 4 years. This restaurant remind me of the restaurants on the Bangkok street. Nothing fancy just the right foods.
author: Wenman L.

description: Chicken pad Thai was decent. A little bit on the sweet side.  But the portion was good for lunch.  The menu appeared to be focused which is great.  I prefer restaurants to have a focus on dishes their great at rather then have over 100s of items they rarely cook.  The service was great. My water was refilled frequently without me asking.
author: Khoi M.

description: Ok service and the Pad Thai was ok. Had to add some sauce to make it flavorful. Ive had better! But ok place. Try it out!
author: Aaron L.

description:
We meant to eat across the street at Kin Khao, but the wait was for an hour for a party of 2. Starved and craving Thai, it just so happened The Old Siam Thai Restaurant was conveniently across the street. Actually most of the diners who could't get into KK, went to Old Siam too. The restaurant was busy during our visit and was constant. Not a huge place, but comfortable for small to large parties. 

We sat a 2 seater that faces the street - great for people watching. We ordered Tom Kha ($9) for an appetizer soup. Enough to serve 4 people in small bowls and we had 2 bowls each. We ordered the soup with chicken and there were a lot of chicken pieces in it. I really enjoyed the soup and the flavor. Needed more chili flakes, however. The extra spices were on the table to easy to add.

For my entree I ordered the Pad See Ew ($10) with Pork and my friend ordered the Pork Belly Chef Speciality with a side of white rice.

My noodles lacked oyster sauce and was bland unfortunately. I hadn't had Thai in a while and I was really looking forward to some delicious Pad See Ew. I was disappointed. The Pork Belly was way too salty for my taste and they were big chunks of what I thought looked liked bacon.  There were a lot of veggies and my friend really thought the pork belly would be on top and not mixed in. It would have been better to just placed the pork belly separate and on its own and customers can mix it themselves.

Service was good and our waters were refilled constantly. It was a quick meal, and glad we had no wait. We probably spent half the price then what we would have spent across the street. The location is borderline sketchy / tenderloin, so I recommend not sticking around too late in the area.
author: Maria C.

description: Went here for lunch, but had to get our orders to go because of the line. Great price point and good, flavorful pad see ew that wasn't too greasy. Also very clean and chic on the inside (very unexpected considering the exterior!).
author: Alice Z.

description: Pretty good for the price! The lunch special was a ton of food. You automatically egg fried rice and tofu pad Thai (meh at best). Then you choose from an A list and B list... both great options. Also you can add a Tom Kah or Tom Yum for $2.99... Tom Kah was amazing!! $11.99 for the lunch special.
author: Nicole F.

description: The old Siam has a great pad Thai & their fried chicken is great, service is always fast and polite. It's a simple restaurant with great food & service a little gem in the downtown/tenderloin area.
author: Rubens T.

description: This restaurant was awwwwesome I visited San Francisco with my son and Friend, and we were only there for three days and ate here twice. The hotel we stayed at recommended it to us and it will not disappoint.
author: Virginie L.

description:
Came here with a friend after walking around Union Square. Truthfully this wasn't our first choice and we only came here because the Thai place across the street in the hotel was PACKED and we were STARVING. 

We were seated right away and the place wasn't busy. The menu was extensive and had the typical Thai food that's offered anywhere else. I opted for a tofu noodle dish (can't remember the name), but it was absolutely delicious! I'm always up for good Thai food and this place did not disappoint. The food came out hot and fresh, the veggies were good and the tofu was cooked with the right amount of crisp on the outside (it was a little fried).

There isn't much to say about the restaurant. Not the best looking decor, very simple and laid back. The staff was attentive. Overall the place was mediocre and the food was great! Definitely worth a try!
author: Tiffany Y.

description:
Stopped by for a quick lunch on the way to a conference at nearby Hotel Nikko. I ordered a Thai iced coffee ($3) the lunch special ($11.95) which came with choice of appetizer, entrée, egg fried rice, and veggie pad Thai. For my app I ordered the chicken satay, and the cat fish prik khing (mild) for my entrée. With tax and tip, the bill was a shade under $20. 

The food was a bit underwhelming. Standout for me was the chicken satay appetizer - juicy and tender, with an excellent sauce. The most disappointing was the catfish - it was overdone to the point of chewiness and the veggies it was served with had too much chili paste on them. The rice and pad thai were fine. 

The restaurant was clean and spacious, and the service was friendly though a tad lackadaisical. This  would have been a four star review if the food had been better.
author: Navin K.

description: We ordered the Duck Fried Rice, Spicy Pan Fried noodles, green curry, Pad See Ew w/ pork, and chicken wings. All were so delicious. We ended up here after the Thai restaurant across the street had an hour wait. Glad that happened because this place is great! Prices are fair and has good proportions. I would definitely recommend all of the items we tried.
author: Rebecca T.

description:
I'm torn. Food was good, but service was definitely not up to par. Even though our name/party of 5 had been circled, indicating we were to be seated next, 3 parties who arrived after were seated ahead of us. When we were seated, we also had a difficult time just trying to have someone take our order. A family of 4 was seated at the table next to us after we sat. With our same luck, the family had their orders taken, and were even served before we were able to place a drink order. 

Granted, it was a Saturday night and the restaurant was busy. However, the entire experience was overshadowed by odd and inattentive service. Our meals arrived at different times - my friend's curry came nearly 15 min after all of our dishes. It came to that awkward should I wait to eat or go ahead, near hangry status, etc. Food was decent, but I could say that I've had better Thai food at similar joints.

Like many others at this restaurant, we were rejects from the trendy Thai restaurant across the street (due to no reservations). Perhaps the staff knew, and that's why we weren't treated like a priority?

Who knows. It's a decent spot, but for this first experience, unfortunately I don't think my friends and I would return. Oh BTW, they add 18% gratuity to parties of 5 or more!
author: Pam B.

description:
Was in the area and we wanted Thai food. This was the only place that didn't have a wait. The wait staff were very friendly . We were immediately seated and given a menu. 

We ordered a Pad thai and vegetable soup with noodles.
I was really excited for the vegetable soup with noodles because It was a cold day and i was hoping this would warm me up.

The presentation of the food was great and looked great to eat.
The pad thai did not disappoint, it was a great size dish and very inexpensive. The dish was bursting with flavors and spice.. YUM!!!! YOU know I love my spice.

I was disappointed with the vegetable soup with noodles. First eating those noodles were a challenge! Coming to flavor this was a bland soup. For someone who is not a fan of spice and flavor this is the dish for you however if you are anything like me who enjoys spice and flavor- don't get this. i even added hot sauce however I feel the hot sauce made this dish taste bad. I tried to eat as much as I could however gave up on it. I really felt like I was ingesting water with vegetables in it.  I got this with a side of white rice. Ended up eating the white rice instead.

I was disappointed with my dish however I should have known better than it having flavor.

Good spot, quick service and good Pad Thai. I can't really comment on anything else as those were the only two dishes I got. If I am ever in town again , I will consider this spot just so I can try something else that has a bit more flavor to it.
author: Binita S.

description: Don't let the "3.5 star" fool you , this place is amazing , the food was perfect, the service was great . I ate here twice , the weekend I was there , but didn't get any pictures because I devoured the food LOL
author: Yvonne T.

description:
It was a quick trip. I was planning on going to Kin Khao across the street but it was too crowded, saw this place and decided to give it a try, as I was desperately needing some yummy Thai food at 9pm.

Ordered their Special Rice Noodle, it was nothing special, wasn't spicy as I requested either. But it came out really fast and I loved the sauce, adding the very reasonable price (less than $10) I'm giving it 4 stars.
author: Carol Y.

description:
My friends and I grabbed dinner here before heading to Bill Graham to see the XX a few weeks ago. We wanted something substantial and Old Siam was the closest restaurant to our hotel. The restaurant was busy when we got there (which is always a good sign), we were lucky to snag a table. 

Here is what we ordered: 

Papaya salad: 3/5 - Fresh ingriendents but it was a little bland
Crab fried rice: 3/5 - Average 
Shrimp paneg curry: 3/5 - Too watery and small portions 
Bbq chicken: 2/5 - Moist but portions were small 
Pad see ew: 5//5 - Really good, nice flavor!
Mango paradise: SKIP! It's 7up, mango chunks and syrup 

Service was fast and everything came out at once but the food was just average. There are many other really good Thai places in the city to try so I wouldn't return.
author: Judy V.

description: Oldie but a goody. The outside awesome neon signs are amazing and walking into this place takes you back decades in time. I ordered my favorite dish Chicken Pad Thai extra spicy and a vegetable rice plate. I really liked the food but my girls thought it was okay. The noodles they used are thinner than the typical thicker noodles in the pad thai.
author: Franklin M.

description:
Decent service, food, and price...maybe a 4 star except one incident.

My husband asked for another napkin before we left. The waitress didn't bring. We got up to leave after our bill was paid.  He took a napkin off an empty table.  Another server scolded him.."just ASK for one!"  He did.  Lol.....poor thng! She must hate her life.
author: Shawn C.

description: Terrible food and terrible service. I love Thai food but this was inedible. The workers were rude and not understanding when we were disappointed with the food they presented to us. If I could I would give this place zero stars. Go get grab a street hot dog and you will be way more pleased than going to this place. The worst part of this place however was definitely the service, at least if you're going to serve nasty food get or train your workers to not be rude to your costumers!!
author: Meredith P.

description:
With no reservation or planning, 6 of us walked over for lunch. It was about noon and we got seated quickly. The place filled up and there were no more seats by the time we left. We started by sharing he fried spring rolls and the rolls that wern't fried. They were both cut into 8 pieces which made Shao ring very easy. Both were delicious. I especially liked the rolls that weren't fried and the peanut sauce. I had two pieces. 
Pad Thai noodles were ok. The noodles were spaghetti like and I prefer a wider noodle. 
The person who is a regular got the drunken noodles and others that tasted it said it was the best dish. The friend hi got the Thai iced tea said it was sweeter than normal. Not crazy about the one unisex bathroom. Location was very convenient to the Hilton and the Parc 55 Hilton hotel and prices were reasonable. If I return, I will get the drunken noodles.
author: Maria-Elena T.

description: Excellent food , everything was just delicious. Best soup I had in the city , very flavorful and enough to share , good service , very nice staff . The area it's a little ugly but if you are there already shopping or walking it's a good place to eat .
author: Jenny G.

description: Food was decent and satisfies a Thai craving, but nothing special. The one star is from the rude service. After we paid our bill and left, our server came to chase us down and threatened us that we needed to pay more because 20% tip is mandated by California law. We called on her bullshit - first of all we did pay 20% on the pre-tax total, which is what it should be based on, not the post-tax amount they displayed on the receipt. Secondly, we're not tourists so we weren't about to be bullied into paying more tip based on a blatant lie. The server mumbled something and went back into the restaurant. Good riddance and good night.
author: Yang Yang L.

description:
We were strolling around the Tenderloin before a concert at the Warfield (one of my least favorite places in SF for a twilight meander), and were getting antsy about finding a place to eat after the place we had in mind had someone on drugs screaming immediately outside of the entryway - funny how those kinds of details have yet to present themselves on Yelp. 

We decided we were cool with Thai, and swung in here completely at random and were surprised to find the place was pretty packed for a weeknight. We were immediately seated at the far end of the dining room and given menus and ice water. The service is kind; mostly young women who check in to see how you're doing. We ordered a couple of entrees (soup for me, green curry for him), and hung out for about 15 minutes of people watching before getting our meals. Prices are in the $10-$15 range. 

The food here was surprisingly good! It was on par with places we like to go in the East Bay, and the Seafood Soup had a good variety of meat in it and a reasonable ratio of noodles to broth. I was completely happy with it and would be happy to return. 

Getting in and out was quick for us, but this is a place you could bring the family and enjoy yourself, as well - service isn't trying to get you out in a hurry. With TVs and clean tables, you could easily chill here for an hour or so and enjoy dinner over a couple beers. 

If we ever find ourselves in a similar situation, we'll be back!
author: Laura B.

description: So f*cking good.  Came here on a whim needing sustenance around 9 on a Sunday night.  Ordered the pad Thai with shrimp.  Hot fresh and delicious.
author: L S.

description:
Not recommended. The portion was so small
 that even me (a woman) felt it could not be regarded as a meal. The salad's portion to the pork is 3:1. There's only 10 tiny pieces of pork. The rice tasted like it's from yesterday. It's very dry. The salad is too spicy. Overall, one of my worst experiences in SF.
author: Xiao L.

description:
When I travel to SF (a few times a year), the Old Siam is a must stop for me. I really like the Tham Kha Kai soup and Pad Thai. And it's relatively inexpensive. Dinner usually runs about 25$, which is cheap. This is SF after all!
Nothing is cheap. I don't like the take out set up. The entry way can get very crowded. 

I'm sure there may be better Thai spots in SF but I've never been disappointed.
author: Kenny W.

description: Awesome place! Lots of people packed restaurant when we walked in which is a good sign.  We initially hesitated about this place because Yelp says 3.5 stars average and we don't go anywhere less than 4 Stars. I ordered the seafood soup, hot and sour soup - excellent. The Panang beef was also awesome. Mint lemonade finished the meal nicely.
author: Iggy I.

description: This place has grate tasting food to bad thier service really SUCKS I FEEL LIKE THEY DONT CARE ABOUT THIER CUSTOMERS. The waitres that took our order took it wrong and then wanted us to actually accept the play and charge us for it . Didn't want to except that it was her That took the order wrong . Then when she actually brought the food out practically slammed down the plates on the table we are regulars and always come her atleast 6 to 7 times a month . But no t any more  we are not coming back . Her name was DADA
author: George M.

description:
OMG!! 
I can't believe this place. I never felt so humiliated and I waited so long. 
Looks like this place is very busy and well known in this area. We got there at 8:05 and the waitress showed us to sit in front of the entrance door for a table seated for 4 people. There were five of us. I told her I don't want to block people's way and we were literally facing the door 10 feet away on Jan.1. We waited for an additional 15 minutes to get seated. Once we got seated, we placed an order and didn't any food for 25 minutes for four entrees. When I complained to them, they brought only 2 noodle soups. We waited another 15 mins and still the rest of the food didn't come out. Is it because I didn't order extra drink or appetizers??
author: Jinney C.

description: I went there 3 hours ago to have dinner with my friends. We ordered Fried calamari, reg thai noodle soup, Goog kar something curry and pad see ew. First of all, Fried calamari was awesome but the other dishes were awful. We enjoyed the time so it wasn't bad. However, when we get our check, 18% of the tip was included. Also, they add tax after they include tip. So it was like they charged us 20% of the tip. We were just 3 people and I can not understand why they charged the tip. We asked to off the tip but they said it was added automatically. But it seems not. I saw other customer's review here. I doubted to go to the restaurant and I was right. IT WAS AWFUL DECISION. This restaurant should stop charging tips if they really want to get some tips. THE RESTAURANT SHOULD NOT DECEIVE THEIR CUSTOMERS. For the tourist or visitors might be okay because they might don't know about the auto charge tips. I will never go to the restaurant again.
author: Ariel H.

description: The service was very slow.  Had to wait to be seated and then had to wait over 15 minutes for someone to take our order. As for the food, it was ok. The pad Thai was good (although they screwed up our order and we were suppose to have pad see ew).  My beef larb (ground beef, onions, spices, lime, fish sauce with lettuce cups) was way too fishy and almost inedible. Probably wouldn't return. The prices are very reasonable though
author: Alexandra L.

description: Boy oh boy does this restaurant have some delicious green curry. The service and food was all so good! The spice level was perfect to my liking which is a rare considering most thai restaurants don't make it spicy enough. The dessert was amazing as well. The fried banana and ice cream was D lish and had so much flavor. This place hit the spot and I'll definitely be back again!
author: Suzan H.

description: I wasn't prepared for the city being cold, so after a long day out and night time came, I wanted something warm. Their Tom yum soup was perfect for relaxing in the hotel. Very close to Hilton hotel union square
author: D E.

description: Service was fast but food was just average. Pad se-ew was ok and I also had the chicken breast. Even when it was moist inside it had no flavor ehatsoevet.  The egg rolls were extremely greasy and I didn't like the stuffing.  I love thai food and may eat again there but will need to add lots of species to have better flavor.
author: Joan D.

description: After my latest visit (#4) I had to give this place another star ! Great Food,Good Service..I'm a Fan.
author: Ken F.

description: It was ok. We just stopped in and order a few noodle dishes as well as the soup. The soup was really good.  The noodle dish was also good but not the best ever. The place itself feels a little dirty and the service is not great. I would ignore the service if it felt a little cleaner but almost seems like they don't care. Price is good so if you're looking for decent food, with minimal service then this is a good place.
author: Olivia B.

description:
This was a pretty good restaurant with decent food and beverages. However, when the price is taken into account it's definitely worth at least trying. Most of the dishes are 10 dollars or less, making this a budget restaurant that actually delivers pretty good food! The interior and service are nothing special, but are certainly passable. The menu is also extensive, with many different options available alongside different preparations of the same dish. We ordered the eggplant and salmon dish (with rice on the plate as well) and it was really delicious. If I had to be picky, the salmon might have been better seasoned. We also ordered a chicken and bamboo bird's nest, which was relatively hard to eat but also quite good. I think it just made me realize I don't have a huge love for bird's nest noodles. Finally, we ordered drinks; a Thai iced tea which was spot on, and then a strange mix of flavor syrup, Sprite, and mango slices. I think it was too sugary and probably wouldn't order it again.

All that said, I'd probably return or recommend it to others!
author: John B.

description:
Very good vegetarian food! Can't speak for non veg. Tasty and filling. Would definitely try it again. Pretty economical too. 

Don't forget to try the vegetarian noodle soup.
author: Gurunath H.

description:
Ambiance was ok.  He place seemed busy and rushed and it was quite loud.  Didn't feel I connected with the servers, they just seemed stressed and focused on their job and not interested in being friendly or engaging.

When I go to new for me Thai restaurants, I order Tom Kah Gai to decide how good and tasty everything is.  I ordered it medium spicy, which was perfect.  What it lacked was taste.  It was very bland and didn't excite my palate.  I think there was too much coconut and not enough sour to balance it out.  For $12+ it was slightly on the higher side of what I'm accustomed to down in SoCal.  Thai Iced tea was good.  So overall, it was Meh.  I'm just visiting the area and would not go out of my way to return here.  I will try another of the many others in the vicinity.
author: Eric A.

description:
I go here for lunch most of the time but one time during a night out with my friends, we wanted to just have desserts but we were turned down because it's a minimum order of $8.00 or more !!! Wow can't believe this and we did not know. 
You will lose customers with this policy or I guess they don't want to serve desserts cuz maybe they think we will share a few plates. 
Anyways, might be back for awhile
author: Lourdes A.

description:
Excellent! The lunch special deserves a 5 star. While the outside has that classic old school look, the inside is newer and importantly - clean. The Tom Kha soup was perfect as was the Penang curry. The chicken satay and peanut dip was excellent.

Get the luncheon special if your hungry. I could not finish it!
author: Robert B.

description: Good food and food service , you should try this place and don't go across to Kin Khao where they have bad service and expensive and limited menu .
author: Mano S.

description: The food was okay and service was terrible. We walked in and was told to wait as they checked on our table. When we were sat we didn't get our orders taken for the next 20 minutes. The food was not anything special and they didn't come out with all the food together. They also take a 18% gratuity on any tables of five or more. Come if you are super hungry and you can't get into Kim Khao.
author: Chelsey O.

description:
Ordered the Pad Thai and left 75% of it on the plate. It was not edible. The noodles were thin spaghetti sized and the sauce tasted like a combination of fish sauce, ketchup (not heinz, but the cheap bargain type from the dollar store) and a whole lot of sugar.

The room reflected the neighborhood, worn and neglected. Not recommended.
author: Robert C.

description: 2/4 dishes my buddy and I ordered tasted very much like pinesol, probably just because there was cilantro fried into the food we decided, although we're. Both cilantro lovers, we didn't love this.  Their pumpkin curry was ok also their staff was great.
author: Benjamin A.

description: Just ok... I had the beef larb with sticky rice and a small bowl of the tom kha gai soup with veggies. Nothing remarkable. We came for the low prices and that was the highlight. Service was surprisingly bad since there were only 4.5 people in the restaurant. My friend's water glass was empty for the majority of our meal while our waitress was on her phone  #issanoformedawg
author: Tia S.

description: Reliable Thai food at decent prices. The service was very friendly. Caters more to a white business crowd. "Medium spicy" was not particularly spicy by my tastebuds, but there were seasonings on the table.
author: Scott Z.

description: First of all, the service was terrible. Yam, our server, was very passive aggressive despite our excessive thank yous.She didn't check up on our table, she was standing around on her phone, and rolled her eyes when I asked for more water.The food was ok, but it seemed like they just warmed up pre made food. We were then presented with our check which INCLUDED gratuity even though it didn't say that it was included in the menu. Thankfully Yam took it off at our request but still that seems pretty shady to do that so be warned!!Overall, I'd pick a different establishment to eat at.
author: Cynthiacabrales123 ..

description: Food is good small portions but good.Only complaint have is the customer the service.The waitress was rude, I spent 50$ and had to pay 20cent for a bag.Or carry my boxes of food out in hand. Didn't like that at all!
author: Mercedes F.

description:
( Reseña en español a continuación)
Last night my family and I were wandering out to find somewhere to eat. This place was the only one open at the time and we quickly got inside to order. The food was good, and the prices were no surprise being SF. It was night time so there were not that many guests and the waitresses were attentive to us. The only thing that made me rate this place a 2 star is because of the way they acted at the end. I know it's rather unusual these days to tip in cash, but we did. We left them tips on the table and one of the waitresses didn't wait for us to leave the table when she took the tip and began counting it. She returns and now two of them are telling us that on the receipt it was a 15% gratuity. First, GRATUITY is what we, as the customers, wish to pay them extra for their services. Second, if they wanted us to forcibly pay additionally 15$ more they should've included the tip in the bill. And third, the audacity to DEMAND we give them more was ridiculous. They ruined our night simply by being like this. I understand if they were tired and wanted to close the place but to take it out on the customers is no way to bring us back. Definitely not returning to this place. 


Anoche estuvimos paseando alrededor de las diez de la noche a buscar algo qué comer. Este restaurante fue el único que estaba abierto a estas horas y mi familia y yo nos metimos a comer. La comida fue exquisita aunque siendo San Francisco el precio fue predecible. Las meseras fueron muy atentas. La única cosa que fue lo que causó que les diera dos estrellas es que al pagar nosotros decidimos dejar la propina en la mesa en lugar de escribirlo en el recibo como es usual. No sólo la mesera nos arrrebató el dinero de la mesa cuando aún seguíamos ahí (claro se notaba su prisa porque ya querían cerrar el restaurante). Pero luego regresaron el dinero y nos dijeron que la propina tenía que ser el 15%, o sea 15$ de 'gratuidad'. Para empezar, la palabra dice 'gratuidad' no significa que sea necesario. Segundo, si querían que a fuerzas les pagáramos ese 15%, lo deberían haber puesto en el cheque, y no como propina. No fueron para nada profesional, sé que quizás estaban cansadas y que querían cerrar,  pero la manera que actuaron no nos gustó para nada. Nos arruinaron el resto de la noche por su manera brusca de pedir propina. No volveremos a regresar.
author: 永子

description: Food is solid came here twice on my business trip. Their potion is large, I have no problem w their services.
author: Chica I.

description:
My friends and I were looking for a good Thai place to eat at. We saw this on yelp and it had good reviews so we decided to check it out. We ordered 4 dishes and overall the food was okay only.

We ordered the chicken pad Thai, old Siam duck, sweet chicken, and the special plate (papaya salad, grilled chicken with sweet sauce on the side, and stick rice).

The chicken pad Thai was not very flavorful. I did like the noodle size. The old Siam duck was probably the best dish we had. It was stir fried and had a good amount of flavor. I do wish the skin on the duck was crispier. The sweet chicken was okay - the sauce tasted just like sweet and chili sauce used with egg rolls. The special plate was very plain. Overall, I probably won't be coming back to this place.
author: Kei V.

description: This a a great find! Very authentic cuisine and great prices. Most people at the restaurant were Asian. Always a good sign when wanting good Thai food for a reasonable price.  My dish was a prawn and asparagus dish. A little spiced for me, but I am a total wimp.  My friend ordered the chicken coconut soup. A crazy large portion. The fried calamari was awesome.
author: Michelle S.

description: I've been on a search for a go to Thai place and this place is it. We were heading to the hipster Thai place across the street but the wait was an hour long so we walked across to try this place instead. And so glad we did! I would have never thought to look for my go-to place in Union Sq. I heard this restaurant has been here for a long time, so they must be doing something right. They have a great vegetarian menu! The food was very tasty, seasoned and spiced well. Service was pretty good and fast, menu items were cheap for SF (especially Union Sq), portion sizes were respectable, and the food came out really fast...all at once. Couldn't really ask for more from a real deal Thai place.
author: Melissa C.

description: The food was good but our waitress was not. Dry good. The quantity was pretty good too. But we were made to wait for quite some time and then they got our soup and entree at the same time.
author: Shruti M.

description: Came here for lunch. They have a decent lunch special with an appetizer and entree that comes on one plate. I felt that it was very good food, mostly authentic, and quick service.
author: Gordon F.

description:
God.Awful.
I would like to write this off as a one-off bad experience, but my family's decision to come here was a very bad one. We chose to come here on a whim and got seated after a brief wait. I ordered a Tom Yum Noodle Soup and my mom and brother each ordered their own soup dishes. My Tom Yum Noodle soup tasted nothing but sourness. I get that Tom Yum is supposed to be a bit sour, but this was to the point where I tasted nothing else.. I tried my brother's dish and found that it had the exact same problem.
Servers came by and went for the most part, stopping at our table maybe twice to fill up our water. I would  have just give two stars if it wasn't for when we were about to leave....

My mom felt justifiably very disappointed the food and service and left cash to cover our whole meal and tip. Just as we are getting up to leave, one server comes around, looks into where we paid, and THEN, had the audacity to tell us that we weren't tipping them enough and 15% is listed on the receipt! We were all flabbergasted. My mom ended up leaving a couple more dollars, but she should not have needed to! We left an amount of tip that we thought was appropriate for the food and service we received and here they go demanding more tip? Seriously?

Don't go here. There are much better choices out in SF.
author: Thuan T.

description:
After trying to book in to another Thai restaurant around the corner we ended up here because the other had a 40minute wait. This restaurant was a little more, let's say, dated than the other but none the less we got seated immediately and we were hungry so that's all that really mattered. 

The staff were great, we were seated and served quickly and from order the food was with us within 10 minutes.

I ordered chicken pad Thai, my usual order, and I was impressed with the taste but I was more impressed with the portions. It was easily enough to feed two people. Flavour wise it perhaps lacked a bit of a kick but I asked for a fresh lime and that gave it that little extra. 

There was a good choice of authentic beers on offer too (Chang or Singha)! All in all it was great but the restaurant could do with a lick of paint and a freshen up.
author: Stevie M.

description:
Just got to San Francisco and after that long plane ride we decided first things first after check in...FOOD!  So my friend stated I've never had Thai, is it good?  So my only answer to that was UH Yeah!!  & you need to have this in your life so let's find a place... our door man told us one of the locations that most people who stay here talk about so we went with that recommendation.  Off of first sight it wasn't all that appealing, but I said aye I'm sure it is goin to be good, most smaller places end up being that way, based off of experience.  The hostess was really nice and we must've gotten there just in time because there was no wait and plenty places to choose to sit.  I had to make sure that we tried dishes that weren't too extravagant since she's never been, so I ordered spring rolls w/sweet chili sauce, drunken noodles w/chicken (spicy pan fried noodle) & some roasted duck on the side.  She got the Basil chicken w/rice.  For dessert we ordered ice cream (mango & taro).
EVERYTHING was so good, nothing was left on the plate.  The only reason it didn't get a 5star was the service was lacking some, but other than that we were happy.
author: Diana J.

description: Wow. My concierge recommended this place and I'm glad he did.   I ordered the pan fried scallops in mango curry...and wow. It was fantastic! They prepare with medium spices and it was perfect. Not so hot you can't taste the food, yet spicy enough to give it a perfect kick.
author: Amy M.

description: I stumbled upon this place on a random visit to the city! Service was great and the food was delicious! As a vegetarian, they definitely had a wide variety of choices and my; favorite mango sticky rice! Would definitely eat here again!
author: Jazmin J.

description: Great Thai food located in the union square area of San Francisco. The chicken curry was great and very flavorful. No complaints about anything. Service was great, food was great, atmosphere was great. Great place to visit if in the area.
author: Everett W.

description:
Worst service EVER! We went to this place with a group of 5 for lunch. We sat down at a table. After just sitting there for 20 mins with our menus, we asked the waiter if someone would take our order, she said " I will be back". Came back 10 minutes later and we finally ordered our food and drinks. 
The food came out quick for all of us, except one. After about 5 mins of us getting the food, the waiter brought out a plate, which was clearly not what my friend ordered. We told her and she took the food away. About 10 mins later, we called our waiter and asked where's the food. She said "it's coming". Keep in mind by that time we had been there for over 40 mins. We started eating our food, since we were on a tight schedule. 
Finally when we were all almost done, we called another waiter/manager and again asked for my friends food AGAIN.
She went to the kitchen, then came back and said "oh your server made a mistake. But they are making your food now. You still want it?" By that time all of us were done eating and my friend asked for her food " to-go". They brought her food together with our check. Do you think they at least discounted her plate??? Of course no! Complete absence of any basic customer service!!!
author: Vlada C.

description: We had lunch here when visiting SF. The prices were very reasonable and the food delicious. We've got to keep this one in our minds for the next time we're in town.
author: Joseph J.

description: Love this place! Great prices and food is really good. Make sure you try their mango curry and the tom kha gai soup. They do take out and everything is ready in 15 min.
author: Silvia P.

description:
Well I did come back, after a pretty bad experience at a gentrified-ass snooty Thai place across the street that will remain nameless, and it was most excellent. We ordered:

- shrimp pad thai
- yellow curry with chicken
- garlic fish
- pineapple fried rice 

Pretty pedestrian choices, I admit, but they totally hit the spot. And the price was fair. I would come back!
author: Aivy C.

description:
Pad see ew and Tom yum soup were ok.

Service needs improvement. Before New Years this place was packed and the wait too long for my toddler. So, we came back New Year's Day as they were one of the only places that was open. Service was not friendly and they treat take out customers like cattle. Maybe it's the setup and they need to change kitchen entry to be away from front desk. 

At any rate, slow service, ok food, and I just came here because they were open.
author: C N.

description:
This Khao Soy tasted just like I ordered it in Chiangmai! 
So pleased I came across the street from the trendy, annoyingly SF-priced Thai place.
Way more authentic, casual, great value and delicious.
author: Alana M.

description: I have good memories here. Many lunches with friends and colleagues. Good place to catch a quick meal. Quick and friendly service. Delicious food.
author: Margarita D.

description:
Good value for downtown San Francisco.  Predictable Thai food menu, breath of fresh air after the gourmet Thai place across the way.  

The food was hot and served reasonably quickly after we ordered.
author: Tim P.

description:
I come here with my bf and we absolutely love it there fast and the layout of the restaurant is pretty cool 
Overall great experience
author: Ruth P.

description: Came in on a whim for some Thai food since we were staying at a nearby hotel. We ordered the pad see eww chicken and by the time we opened the container low and behold the noodles are half cooked and not an ounce of sauce included in the dish. I respect the fast service, but please include quality in your dish.
author: Charleston P.

description: The coconut chicken soup with hint of lemongrass is sublime, I cannot stop craving it, I savored every sip, I am ruined because of it, there will never be another....OK I went back and order the soup as my entree and yes it was consistent with my first visit...Amazing see photo
author: Laurie L.

description:
Just landed in San Francisco and we wanted something quick but tasty to fill our bellies.  Walked one block from our hotel and saw a Thai restaurant; at first glance not appealing to the eye but we are use to this coming from NYC, decided to give it a try anyways. 
Second thing you will notice there is an awkward entrance to the restaurant, should have walked away at this point.. Once inside there is an odor I couldn't place... Musty/old maybe mold either way disgusting wouldn't not recommend dinning. We ordered:
Pad Tai ( shrimp ) 1-10  we gave it a ZERO! Horrible dish 
BBQ pork fried rice 1-10 we gave it a 3 only because at this point we are starving and will eat anything. 
Do not recommend !
author: Jessica L.

description: The food tasted good. But they had forgotten our orders and we had to waited for almost an hour for our starter. In the mean time some friends of the restaurant arrived and they get to have their food before us.
author: Ed Y.

description: Walking distance from tons of hotels in the area. Food comes out quick if you are in a crunch. The pad thai and pad see ew did not have much flavor. Overpriced dish for the lack of flavor.
author: Nicole Anne S.

description: Excellent food and service. The tomyum soup is just nice not too spicy. Must have. Restaurant is clean and the waitresses greet you the moment you come in and serve you with a round of iced water first
author: Dennis N.

description: The food is so fresh, the portion sizes are HUGE for what you pay. It's a little hole in the wall, and if you didn't know it was there, you might miss it. But please try it out!!! I will travel from South Bay to SF just to grab food from here! You can't go wrong!
author: Amber T.

description: Took my friends to this place for dinner but we were so disappointed. Customer service were really awkward, we asked lemon but never brought to us even till we finish the dinner, waitress did not even gave us water and not even checked on us. Only 1 waitress was friendly and know how to service customers.The only reason I am giving 1 star is because the food tasted alright, otherwise we would never come back and eat there again. Last part is very tricky, we refused to pay 18% tips which was pre charged on our bill without our agree.  We don't even feel like gave 10% tips for this kind of customer service but waitress even refused to change the amount of the tips because it was in the computer system.  Anyway, the food tasted alright but with this kind of customer service I am  sure no one would go back again.
author: Max M.

description: Yes yes yes! My first visit I ordered the Pad Thai with chicken and jasmine rice. I couldn't believe how amazing it was, so good that I went back the next day and ordered Thai chicken fried rice.. Once again I was not disappointed. Also, the portion sizes are extremely generous. Thank you for making my stomach happy.
author: Monique N.

description: on July 14 all of my family went to have dinner , food was good but service was very poor. specially most of the waitress seem very unhappy and sad.  As a guest when we had to ask questions the waitresses seems upset and unwillingly answered questions.  the way they behaved were feels like the owner never paid them salaries. 2 of them were worse.  Restaurant business is more about good customer service and being nice. but this restaurant 's staff were behaving insulting manner
author: Subash C.

description: The service was friendly and quick. It's pretty clean inside. There was nothing outstanding about anything we tried. Pad Thai was below average- very dry and I even tend to prefer my pad Thai on the drier side. The Penang and green curries were tasty and spicy. The little shrimp wraps were fine too. I didn't care for the fried rice. But you got a large plate of food with the lunch combo.
author: Piper W.

description:
I dont nderstand why people are in the service industry if they dont want to help people No greetting,no smile except amongst themselves.
Food was average but we were never checked on. After eating felt like i ate a bowl of oil...one of the worst thai restraunts i have ever experience...disappointing have wanted to eat here for quite sometime.
author: fred h.

description: Looking for a good late take out? This is the place! First time & here, it blew our mind! We ordered the duck noodle soup & spicy seafood. The spicy seafood was flavorful but the noodle soup was lack in flavor. The price  is a bit pricey but then again we are in SF. We will come back !
author: Liony H.

description: Based on the reviews my expectations were pretty low. But the food was good. Clean, decent service, and well priced . I'd come back again for a quick satisfying Thai meal. I got the #50 house special noodles.
author: Chato S.

description:
Not the best quality food you can get on a budget but service and people inside are good if you're trying to take a date there on a budget is nice but if you're looking for a sensational food, you may want to look for other options.
For two of us, 2 meals + 1 dessert costs 37$ + tip
author: Iman S.

description: I had lunch here twice during a recent visit to San Francisco, after noticing it was busy every day at mealtime. I thoroughly enjoyed both experiences. It's not the best Thai food I've ever had, but it was very good and inexpensive. The lunch special is only $11.95 and includes an entree, vegetable pad thai, an appetizer and rice.
author: Teena M.

description: Please don't go to this place. I used to go to this place once in a while, but last time when i went with my friends, they overcharged me $2.99 more than I wrote on my check.
author: Henry T.

description: It couldn't believe how bad it was. Maybe I ordered the wrong dish (seafood rice plate), but the main flavor was coming from salt...and it was over salted...otherwise just bland taste, veggies didn't seem all the fresh or flavorful either. Service was not so impressive either...just barely there...not coming back and do not recommend.
author: Jyl B.

description:
Great food

Nice plating!

We really enjoyed the spring rolls, pad, and kalamari.

Everything was cooked perfectly and well balanced
author: Doc U.

description: I really like this place - their service is quick,efficient, and friendly. Their prices are moderate and the food is delicious...i ordered duck soup with egg noodles which was very tasteful. I also had ground beef with rice - it was a little on a spicy side but still really really good... I will be back for sure
author: George B.

description: This is a must stop place when I am in town.   Right next to two Hilton hotels and a short walk from Union Square. This place is easy to get to, packed with customers, and has amazing food. They make THE best Tom Kha Gai!
author: Cindi A.

description: Service is slow with wait staff gathered at cashier station entertaining themselves.  Had to ask for condiments.  Food delivered by a male who immediately left.  Food was fair to okay but priced at equal to better quality Thai food.  Left a marginal gratuity equal to the service and food received.
author: Jody R.

description: Pad Se-Ew equals best meal I have had in a while. My friends know when I travel that I love Thai food and this place nails it.
author: Greg F.

description: This is my go to spot when im in the city for dinner and craving Thai. Calamati salad is so fresh tasting and cooked perfect. Mango tango is my favorite dish along with the scallops.
author: ELSA C.

description: Stopped by this place for take out with friends. Horrible horrible service. Being that this restaurant is in a busy area you'd think they would have good customer service skills. Nope! First of all it took them around 15-20 min just to take our order. During that time workers were walking past us not even acknowledging our existence. I finally got fed at stopped a server and she lifted her finger to say hold on. Like um no. I've been waiting for 15 min. Finally, the server took my order. She either 1, did not understand what I was saying or 2 was not paying attention because she messed up my order. Took another 10 min just to get her attention to fix the problem. After taking my order we waited another 20 min just for our order to be ready. The server then had the audacity to question us about what we ordered. Like what kind of establishment is this? The food was honestly wack, no flavor, very poor customer service and small portions. Honestly I'm sure they're better Thai food places in town. They really need to work on their customer service. Very bad. 1 star is generous.
author: Bambi O.

description:
This is a great place to go for a reasonably priced dinner in the Union Square area.  The food is consistently great.  It isn't going to break any new grounds for amazing new flavor profiles, but it is solid good Thai food in an area filled with over-priced just okay-food.  It is also just a fun restaurant, filled with people and the staff is great.   Portions are generous and the spice-level is perfect.  If you are used to spicy food, the medium will work for you.  If you aren't used to spicy food, definitely ask them to tone it down.
Lemongrass chicken was the star.  Soups all good.
Appetizers tend to the deep fried side, so not for me, but others liked them.
Beer/wine only.
author: michelle w.

description:
Service: the ladies are very polite and quite attentive. Not much else to talk about as their performance as waitresses are as expected. 

Ambiance: very informal. Lots of people that work in this area come here for lunch so that's the kind of crowd you can expect! 

Food: very tasty and very affordable! The lunch combo special gives you a little of everything for just about $10 so it's definitely worth it!
author: Greg Y.

description: Yummy pad Thai, really fast and good service, reasonable prices (less than $10) this place definitely satisfied my craving after a hike
author: Elizabeth L.

description:
The Pad Thai was rather strange for me, the noodle isn't what I normally eat with Thai friends. Must say it was still tasty though I would not mix it too sweet. Perhaps go lighter and mix them well. The portion is good with money. 
The restaurant is clean and quite dark. Some waitresses are nice and some are not. Please smile! I know you are tired and all but we come in to look for good food and good service. Otherwise we would pay less for cooking. Remember you earn tips on though services! I did tip coz some deserved it.
author: Bao V.

description: Thai iced tea, pad Thai, pineapple fried rice,  mango curry, and fried chicken are some of what makes up this practically perfect menu. Come here hungry and leave happy.
author: Joshua B.

description: Pretty average Thai food but expensive for the portion size, also they charged me $2 for white rice when typically it comes with the meal so I felt a tad ripped off. Not good enough to want to go back.
author: Jake M.

description: Solid Thai place in the TL. For better or for worse, I find most Thai places in the city pretty similar. I have yet to find a place that has blown me away, but that doesn't mean I didn't thoroughly enjoy my meal here. We came before 6pm which meant we got to do the combo meal. I had the red curry, veggie pad thai, fried rice and shrimp rolls. I didn't love the rice or shrimp rolls since they were a little bland. The Thai ice tea was really rich and big!
author: Jane H.

description: Great for lunch. Lunch specials have good portions.  Had the panang chicken combo. $14.95 which includes fried rice, chicken satay, pad Thai and Tom kha soup.  Everything was spiced well except soup could have been spicier. I would return!
author: D K.

description: Good priced food and the combination plate was a good deal, but the pad Thai and curry wasn't the best we've had. The lemon grass chicken had a good kick to it!
author: Steve N.

description: More like 3.5. Place was packed for a Tuesday night at 10.  Good sign! Place is 90 degrees with no moving air at all.  Plenty of servers to handle the crowd. Hot sauce condiments were on the tables. Portions were generous and prices cheap.  I would stay away from the beef broth soups. Taste like 100 packets of top ramen packets were put in it.  Blah.  The coconut soup was the best I've ever had.  Green curry was good but way too many onions. Flavor was delicious.  Very convenient to park 55 and hilton hotels.
author: Vida A.

description: I enjoyed the food here. I really like red curry and they had a mango curry that I really liked. My friends had the specials, which included a diverse and large portion of food for a good price. I enjoyed the calamari and their wings too. The appetizers were large enough to share amongst four people. Its not a bad stop, decent food and very good service.
author: Ursula T.

description: Simple unassuming place.  Nice lunch stop.  Seated quickly and service was good.  Large menu so takes time to choose.  Prices were also on the reasonable side for this part of town.  Had thai beef soup and calimari appetizer.  Calamari was very good, though sweet sour sauce was not to my liking.  Soup was HUGE, very hot and good, though could have been bit more beef in it, but still enough I could not finish it all.  Overall nice stop that I would try again.
author: Chris H.

description: Great Thai food near Union Square! Happened on this great place...not so much the atmosphere which could have used updating but the food was fantastic. I loved the Lemongrass chicken, loaded with flavor and done lightly spiced as I asked. Others in our party were also thrilled with the Sweet chicken and the beef noodle soup. The fried rice was also really good. Next time we are in San Francisco, we will be coming back.
author: Lili Z.

description: We ordered Spicy Eggplant, Mango Curry and Pineapple Fried Rice, which all were excellently flavourful with fresh vegetables. The place is very clean and the waitress and people are very nice and attentive. Hot tea was kept full and Chang beer was cool & crisp. Thank you!
author: Ellie E.

description: The Tom kha gai soup here is the best I've ever had. Also tried the pad Thai and a few other veggie dishes, they were just "meh", but I'd go back just for the amazing  soup! They also had the food ready for pick up pretty fast.
author: Tracy B.

description:
On a mission for dinner in the Union Square area on a Monday night, I stumbled upon this place, checked the Yelp reviews, and headed on in with the intention of ordering food to go.  However, once inside, I decided to eat in... the staff was friendly and the environment casual; and welcoming to single diners.  There were plenty in there while I was there.

I asked my server for her favorite items as I was torn on what to order.  She didn't steer me wrong.  I ended up going with the Fresh Roll appetizer and Salmon Green Curry entree.  The Fresh Rolls were mediocre but I highly recommend the Salmon Green Curry.  It is served piping hot and has plenty of veggies (green beans, eggplant, red pepper) along with a healthy piece of salmon.  The curry has a kick, which I loved.  Perfect for soaking up my side of white rice.  I found the prices to be moderate, especially considering the size of the portions... I wish I would have gotten some pics of my food; my phone died right when I arrived.  I will have to go back and snap some on a future visit.

If you find yourself in the area with a Thai Food craving, you can't go wrong at The Old Siam!
author: Gabi M.

description: Great Pad Thai ( the vegetarian option with just tofu of course) and amazing iced coffee.  Lucked into this little slice of Thailand almost on accident. I'm grateful that  i did.
author: Mike T.

description: The foods soso. Came twice but nth rly stood out. The reason why im giving only one star is because they're racist af. There's a sign on the entrance of the restaurant in Chinese ONLY saying no smoking within 15ft blah blah blah. Okey. Then on the receipt they specifically underline the tips recommendation portion. Wtf?? Not to mention the service is also horrible. Never check on us or anything.
author: Sharie H.

description: The food here is great and flavorful. It is one of my favs in the city. Have to order the pad thai. Their special house rice noodle dish is also goood!
author: Ellie D.

description: Probably the best Thai food we have had anywhere in the continental USA. Price is great, good service. Lots of vegetarian options too.
author: Dulal O.

description: I got shrimp pad Thai take out add chicken I had 3 shrimp in the dish and all the noodles were stuck together I had to use a KNIFE to eat it so I could cut it. I love Thai and I must say this was the worst I have ever had
author: Alexi K.

description: Went here for dinner before seeing a show. I had the Tom Kha Gai and thought it was great. Servers are friendly and, as long as you don't mind waving for them, pretty fast. Food came out in a perfectly reasonable amount of time and the food felt like a good value.
author: Jeremy B.

description:
Since there was a 40 minute wait for Kin Khao and we were hungry, we decided to go across the street instead.  There wasn't any wait for this place.

We ordered the Pad See Ew, which was good, and the Green Curry Avocado.  We didn't read the description, but had thought the curry was going to be made with avocado, which we thought would be interesting.  It's not, it's just very spicy green curry with big chunks of avocado in it.

It's not a bad place for Thai, and the bill came out fairly cheap.  Service was fine, but the waitresses always seem so busy and it took a while to flag them down.
author: Karen L.

description:
I ordered the pad Thail, chicken satay, and an appetizer. The food was delicious! We were wandering around the union square area hunting for food and stumbled into this place. The food will not disappoint and I would give it 
BUT I am a stickler for customer service. The food came out one item at a time which i guess is ok but I don't want to wave you down for water or napkins or chili sauce or any other item I need. And I loath needing something and seeing the staff standing around giggling with each other. 
I would eat there again
author: Rachelle W.

description:
The chicken yellow curry had so much chicken in it, a definite 5 star in my book considering Thai yellow curry is usually on the conservative side with chicken, haha. It was definitely really good, one of my favorite Thai dishes. 

The crab fried rice was AWESOME. Generous amounts of crab pieces mixed in. Tons of flavor considering it's a fried rice dish. 

Thai iced tea was super good and had a really strong flavor to it. A little on the sweeter side than I'm used too, but still really good.
author: Shela D.

description:
Fantastic place!
Great Food!
Great Pricing!
Love coming here a lot when I'm in SF.
I hate that on Yelp they insist that you say
More than you really want to..
So that's why I'm writing this!
author: Jeffrey M J.

description:
Food is average, but the worst is that they didn't put a candle in my mom's bday dessert or even tried to when we asked twice 

Ummm thanks... For nothing?
author: Hanna X.

description:
Three stars for the food but an additional one for the service!
This place was literally across the street from our hotel. We could see it from our room. 
Went in for a late dinner. 
The service was excellent; super helpful when asked the best dishes on the menu. 
Be careful of the spice level. We love spicy food but wow the extra spicy was HOT!!!! 
Everything was pretty good. 
Crowded 
Kind of clean, not immaculate
author: Only Hell Yes Y.

description: In town for a few days.  Lived in SE Asia many years. Craving good Thai food at a reasonable price. This place is it. Went here twice. Had green curry chicken, pineapple fried rice, papaya salad.  All tasty authentic selections. Service very good, nice atmosphere. They have both Singha and Chang to complement the meal.
author: Art K.

description: The building caught my eye and I had to try it out! At first the menu looked like a traditional American Thai restaurant, but I found a dish on the special menu with duck that intrigued me. The food came out fast, so I was uncertain of the quality, until I took a bite. The duck was cooked perfectly and had a little spicy kick that really made the dish work. The dish was simple and full of flavor, which is a high mark in my book. I love how the restaurants in SF don't dumb down the spices for Americans. This makes for a more rewarding dining experience.
author: Gary G.

description: Delicious food.  Had a great lunch today.  The specials were awesome and I added a cup of Tom Yum soup.  I don't think I'm going to be hungry for dinner.  Great Iced tea.  The lunch portions were huge.  And very fair prices for the location.  The service was excellent.
author: Michael K.

description: A great deal for lunch and had a really decent green curry. I however, needed to add a little more heat because I like my Thai spicy. I found this green curry to be a familiar recipe and was glad for that.
author: Lauren E.

description: Only went here because Kin Khoa does not offer To Go or delivery and we needed a meal to being back to the hotel. Stopped in and ordered. Walked back to the hotel and opened up our order. 1 order of Pad See Ew and 1 Order or papaya salad. The Pad See Ew has NO sauce. It's only dry noodles, chicken and Chinese broccoli. The papaya salad is soggy and definitely nit Mild in spice. Tastes like it's been sitting around for awhile. Not worth the 5 minute walk back to complain and wait for a correction. This place is mediocre and wouldn't suggest unless you're looking to fill your stomach.
author: Mary Christine C.

description:
I stayed at the Hilton across the street and my room faced this joint. I swore to myself, SWORE, that I was going to hit this spot at least one time during my week in San Francisco. 

SWORE. 

The Monday came and went. 

Tuesday was a super-late night out that came and went. 

I got a free dinner (thanks Gatorade) on Wednesday night. 

Thursday night was at the Madden Bowl. Came and went. 

I really started to wonder if you week-long dream was going to come to an end. 

It did not. 

I took the fam on Friday night. And it was amazing. 

We went early, which was perfect. I know a lot of people claim that their child is cute. A lot of times, they are right. But a lot of times it's overstated. And I feel like one of the few people in the world who is honest and will call out a baby for not being cute. I have Facebook. I see a lot of not-great-looking kids. Not that they are bad, mind you. Just not as cute as advertised. 

So believe me when I tell you that my child is cute. Maybe the cutest in the world (we'll take on all challengers). But this staff could not be more adoring to my child. Seriously. We are still a little apprehensive when we take our child out in public. Especially in a new city. But the staff here put us completely at ease. So, so friendly. 

And this is before we even ordered the food. 

The vegetable egg rolls were very good. Not the best I've ever had, but very good. 

The scallion patty, though, was the best ever. Holy heck, this was amazing. Make sure you order this. Well, if you like onions. Don't do it if you don't. I hope that goes without saying, but a lot of you Yelpers don't give me a lot of faith. I don't mean that in a bad way, but some of you wary me. 

I'm going to try to remember the entrees we had. There were three. Thai Sukiyaki was absolutely great. Pad noodles. We also did beef with broc and the cashew chicken. I know, not really adventurous; but it's important to have some sort of base dish to judge it against. 

Seriously. I will always order a beef taco/enchilada combo the first time I ever visit a Mexican place. It will help me have something to compare to other places. 

Likewise, I tend to order the same Thai dishes at my first visit. So there you go. I don't know why I feel the need to justify my food order to you, but there you go. 

So we got this grip of food, a couple of beers and apps for less than $70. In San Francisco, which seems impossible. But it was just a great value, great food and wonderful service. 

My regret is that I wasn't able to eat here more. If I'm ever stuck in the FiDi again (I hope not, because I really didn't care too much for the Hilton), I will eat here repeatedly. REPEATEDLY. 

So I beseech you to give this place a spot. Or shot. (I could have just gone back and fixed that typo, but that's me. Typos and all.)
author: Adam R.

description:
The service was horrible.  I got my food 15 minutes after my husband.  That is after he had to get up twice to find the waitress.
The food is also not good. 
We wanted to go to the Thai restaurant across the street but they were booked so we went across the street. BIG MISTAKE!  Awful.  Save your money and time.  Worst meal in SF and we are here 4 times a year. DON'T GO!!
author: Janice R.

description: Probably the best Thai restaurant you can find in this price. The duck noodle soup is my favorite. Almost everything I have tried in this place brings joy to me. Also, it's very cheap which makes me surprise. P.S strongly suggest you to try their Thai ice tea.
author: Frank H.

description: Ate here several times over my 11 days in San Francisco.  Everything I ate from the panang curry to the satay chicken was absolutely amazing!  Just perfect!  Will definitely go back if I make it back to SF.  Mahalo!
author: Mr G.

description: Our last day of trip, we'd like to try real thai food then we found this place by walking supper busy. We were lucky we got table. We ordered pad see ew (beef), chicken fried rice, and roasted duck all of them was  delicious and tasty and also dessert was lovely. Ambiance is ok and service was good. Thx you for the experience.
author: Ari U.

description: This has become my staple Thai restaurant when staying in Union Square...friendly, great / fast service and fresh hot food...all at a reasonable price.  Great place.
author: S K.

description: My friend and I were looking for a Thai restaurant for a late dinner and we walked into Old Siam. We were seated quickly and ordered Thai teas and I ordered the duck noodle soup and she ordered the yellow chicken curry. The thai teas were a bit too sweet and overwhelming. After the drinks came out, we got our entrees. However, I found a large floating fly in my duck noodle soup. I was super grossed out as well as my friend and we requested to leave right away. The waitress apologized and said we would not have to pay for our meal.
author: Sophia D.

description: We had just got into San Francisco a little later in evening and we decided to explore the city and look for dinner. We left the Nikko hotel and started walking down streets that were dark and scary looking with no tourists around. We decided to head back to hotel and we stumbled upon this place. We sat in back of restaurant where it was rather warm and the seating was very close to other tables. My husband ordered a green avocado curry and he said it was the best curry he has ever had.  I cannot remember what i ordered off the chefs special but it was delicious and I took pictures. I am giving this place a 4star because I did not enjoy the tight close tables and very warm in back of restaurant.
author: Brooke N.

description: Had the pork jerky and green curry with rice.  All very good, very fresh and I enjoyed it all.  Service was very prompt and friendly.  Had a nice dinner and will do it again.
author: Ronald C.

description:
I have eaten at this restaurant quite a few times in one week. I thought I would get tired of the food but I haven't. I love the Pad Thai (classic) and the tofu is also great. You don't have to have the tofu and shrimp in the dish. 

I also ordered a Thai Iced Tea, I only wish they had coconut milk or other kinds of milk to substitute the evaporated milk. I think some of the flavor can get lost in all that sweetness. 

The white rice and Thai broccoli is also good, meat can be added.
author: Jodie G.

description:
+ Karee Gai: Chicken cooked in mild yellow curry with potato and onions - can be selected as a rice plate ($8.95) or a la carte ($9.95). Selected the rice option simply because curry includes so much sauce, how else will you eat it - by licking it all up?? Anyway, this yellow curry is fantastic. The chicken is boneless, juicy and tender, the potatoes are perfectly cooked (not too crunchy yet not too soggy), and the curry is absolutely creamy and mild (as advertised, surprisingly).

+ Special Rice Noodle: Flat rice noodle topped with ground chicken, shrimp, squid, tofu, mushroom, and house special sauce, $8.95. So much involved in this dish, talk about party in the mouth! Lots of flavor, lots of texture, lots of goodness. I don't care much for the tofu, but everything else tastes wonderful. I especially love that there is plenty of meat/seafood, so you don't have to hunt around, unsure if you've received all you've asked for, unlike certain other restaurants that are skimpy on such ingredients. Plenty to share, just a matter of whether or not you're willing to share!

This place is narrow, a bit cramped, with a waitlist. It doesn't quite give the best first impression when you enter, particularly if you wind up running into the pole structure that holds the building up while entering through the front door - it's a bit of an odd design. The column is literally right in the middle at the front entrance. Only one bathroom. There's a wide-screen TV that displays a slideshow of a bunch of the menu items, which is helpful, unless you're in a hurry to order and fail to notice the screen until after you've made your tough decisions, speaking from experience...The place is dimly lit, to the point where my photos were not ideal, with or without flash.
