Staff is friendly, tables are small. Definitely would return for the food.
author: Christina L.

description: Just bad all around. How this place stays in business with subpar food and indifferent service is a mystery. We ordered green curry with chicken, yellow curry with chicken, and a pad thai. Our curry dishes were specials that included fried rice and pad thai. The pad thai was flavorless; like another reviewer here, we left most of it on the plate. The fried rice lacked the edge or the heartiness of a good fried rice, and the curries could have come out of a can. Servers don't bother to put the drinks with the person who ordered them; they just put them down at one end of the table. And the only way they returned to fill water glasses was if you flagged them down. One of our group said the food reminded him of old cafeteria food. There are many better options for Thai, even in overpriced Union Square (this place at least was relatively cheap), so I don't see any reason to make a second visit here.
author: Gary M.

description:
First time coming to try this restaurant since they had good reviews and my coworkers often come here to eat during lunch hour on the weekdays. 

I had a bad experience for my first time. The guy who took my table's order got 3 items wrong. One person didn't have their wontons in their seafood noodle soup, another person didn't get their entree until everyone at the table almost finished and they gave us the wrong appetizer. When we told the guy who took our order that we got "crab rolls", he said "no you said combo platter". I told him that I said "crab roll", even when I was ordering it, I had the menu out and pointed to "crab roll". HE STILL GOT IT WRONG. Not only did he not apologize, he just said "ok do you want it then? I can change the order." My coworkers said they never seen this guy here before so he might be the owner or just a new guy. I didn't care, his service for our table was very bad and on top of that, he took so long to write our orders, so I assumed he had everything down correctly.
SMH**

Overall: THE SERVICE WAS BAD. I would not go back there again even if the food is decent.
author: Sandy C.

description:
This quaint little restaurant has become one of my all time favorites and I patronize them at least  once a week.
This restaurant delivers, with both generous portions and a menu that is resonably priced. I've experienced something different from the menu each time I've eaten there and ALWAYS enjoyed what I was served. Even taking suggestions from the staff from time  to  time to change things up, and they ALWAYS come up with a WINNER.
The wait staff is THE BEST. They  work really hard and I've been in there when it been really busy.  They are attentive, pleasant and make me feel welcomed each time. They are extremely professional and definitely worth the higher end of tipping.
The food is served at just the right temperature and seasoning. If you like it spicy, let them know and you'll be happy you did, not overwhelming but a real treat.
The atmosphere in the restaurant is nice, clean and orderly. Once again , the staff is on top of everything.
Being a native San Franciscan and one who enjoys a good place, I highly recommend The Old Siam Thai Restaurant  as a must see and experience .
I hope you enjoy it as much as I ALWAYS do...
author: William W.

description:
The food is good but the service is terrible. Did I say terrible? On a rare warm day, when it's sweltering outside, these folks decide to turn off the AC. A thai restaurant with spicy food and no AC. Go figure. The waitresses don't visit ur table unless called for, or you playing the waiting game.. 15mins, 20 mins...

We ordered the fried banana with mango ice cream, and she returns what seems like an eternity with just the ice cream. We ask about the fried banana and she gives a blank stare and says 'oh do u still want it?'. She goes to place the order for the fired banana, leaving the ice cream behind which is melting away in this heat. We ask her to take the ice cream. After 15 more mins, she returns with the fried banana and the same melted ice cream!! Seriously. On asking about it she says oh this is the last scoop of mango ice cream but I can exchange it for something else if you'd like. Why wouldn't you ask in the first place?! Anyway, bottom line, terrible service.
author: smitha k.

description: Good prices, decent food, fast and friendly service. I usually get the takeout, and one of my standard Thai noodle dishes. It's great for what it is!
author: Vaibhav M.

description:
I really wanted to like this restaurant but was pretty disappointed. I would give it 1 star but some of the food was really good so I decided to give it 2 stars. Some of the food was really good and some of it was really bad. The service was pretty awful on the day that I went with a friend. It seemed like all of the workers were trying to do every job instead of just focusing on certain jobs. We had no idea who our actual server was the whole time because we were helped by several different people. In order to get anything we had to flag down a server as they walked by and I noticed that the tables around us were having to do the same thing.

It started off that they only brought us 1 water when we asked for 2. Not a big deal. Next, we had to wait at least 15 minutes before someone came over and asked if we were ready to order. After we ordered it took a really long time for us to get our food. A large group had come in after we ordered and the group had ordered and received their food before our first dish came so we were pretty annoyed by that. They also brought my friend's entree out first and didn't bring mine at all. He was almost finished with his food when he decided to remind one of the servers that we were still waiting for my dish. He had to ask a second server for my dish again before it was brought out to the table.

We ordered the Pan Fried Chive Cake as an appetizer. Don't get it. It was nice and crispy on the outside but it was mushy, chalky and doughy on the inside. I wasn't sure if it was supposed to be like that or if it just wasn't cooked all the way.

I think the service would be better if they would start assigning a host role, and have the servers assigned to and focus on their own tables instead of all servers helping all tables.
author: Lane G.

description: Excellent food and great service. It is a very busy restaurant so we waited for 10 minutes to get seated. I had the Tom Kha Gai and really enjoyed it. It is very cheap too and considering the price of the food the quality is fantastic. We shared a fried calamari which was crispy. The curries are on the sweeter side. Great place to eat and they are open until late too. Pro tip: me vegetarian friend was very happy with his food too.
author: Mark A.

description: The food is good. I love the pineapple fried rice there and my favorite still the Thai ice tea.
author: Hieu N.

description:
Came in for a late lunch, and they have great specials that includes an appetizer and entree with a variety of items on the plate. There is also an option to add soup to the lunch combo. 

I ordered the pad see ew and it was okay, nothing special. The thai tea was decent. Overall, nothing special, and the pricing is not that cheap either.
author: Celine L.

description: Very good choice of a restaurant. Tasty food, generous portions, and prompt and professional service. Close to Union Square. I had the green curry with chicken. Medium hot is not sizzling; it was just right. Big chunks of chicken and stuffed with veggies. I loved the extra basil! The cucumber salad was at least twice the size of other restaurants, and overflowing. Very reasonable pricing and a large menu. Ample seating. I'll be back!
author: Mark W.

description: I was recommended this restaurant by reception at a hostel I was staying at down the street. The food was absolutely delicious, the portion sizes were generous for the price, and the banana, Nutella dessert was the icing on the cake. Highly recommend this restaurant!
author: Anna G.

description: favorite thai food so far in the city. everything I've tried there, I've loved. Service can be slow but their food is on point.
author: Donna H.

description: The Special Fried Rice (the one with the Chinese sausage in it) and Pad Thai dishes was what I had.  I almost died from eating too much.  This place is super good!
author: Josie X.

description: I decided to have lunch at The Old Siam Thai Restaurant after a workout in San Francisco and I came away very surprised! The prices were quite fair ($10-$13 a meal). I ordered a Thai Iced Tea and a seafood Pad See Ew, and I was completely satisfied with that. The decor and design of the restaurant left a clean and charming impression. The two waitresses were very friendly and charming. Thanks for the meal!
author: Steve N.

description: Very much enjoyed it. Their thom ca gah was excellent, presentation was great, wonderful wait staff. Good location, too. Off Market enough that you can have a quiet meal. Will certainly go again.
author: James H.

description:
We came to The Old Siam Thai Restaurant after visiting the Asian Art Museum.  It was an uncomfortable and somewhat unsafe walk through the Tenderloin to get there.  Thankfully it was an uneventful walk, but I never would have done it after dark nor would I recommend it.

My cousin and I were seated quickly, and our server was quite patient as I tried to look up my previous Yelp review.  We didn't want to order the same dishes twice.

So this time we started with prawns in a lumpia wrap, I forgot what they were called in the menu.  Then we had the spicy seafood and then Lamb Massaman Curry.  We both had eyes on the curry dish, as we had passed it by on our first visit.

The appetizer was really good, it was kind of like a prawn lumpia.  The spicy seafood was as advertised.  There was a wide variety of seafood in the bowl: fish, squid, shrimp, scallops too I think.  It was right at my tolerance of spiciness.  Any spicier and I would not have liked it, because I like to taste my food while I'm eating it.

But the highlight of the meal was the Lamb Massaman Curry.  The lamb was neatly sliced into little cubes.  Each one was cooked perfectly and extremely tender.  It was outstanding!  We cleaned the dish of any remaining sauce with the naan once we had eaten all the lamb.

My only complaint was that the portions of rice were extremely small.  We eat rice like Asian people, not like tourists.  The bowl of rice we received with our entrees was barely enough for one of us.
author: The Bottomless Pi T.

description:
Great food at a great price.

 For most places in San Francisco, the cheapest lunch option you are going to find is going to be $10 or more. At The Old Siam, they daily lunch specials run for $9 or even $8 a plate and they are very good. Filling, full of vegetables, and tasty! (Also deliciously spicy)

I recommend this restaurant to anyone who likes authentic and delicious food on a budget.
author: Drago F.

description: Service was a little leisurely but the Pad Thai and the calamari were very good. The lunch portions were just right and the staff was very pleasant.
author: David A.

description: We ate here as a family of 3. We all enjoyed our food. We found it reasonably priced. Service was quick but not the place for you if you want good interaction with the wait person.
author: Ruth B.

description: Super slow service. Took nearly 15 mins for a server to take our order. Then about 25 mins for the food to come through. Not overly priced so therefore you pay for what you get. We ordered a combination fried rice and a pork pad thai which was pretty average. But overall i would recomend this place to end a hunger urge.
author: Natasha M.

description: This was a 4 star because it wasn't fancy. The soups were really good and the fried rice was also.  If you bring kids with you they are very friendly with them they are also really friendly with adults. They give you time to think about what you want to order      They also have a restroom
author: Nadav Keren G.

description: Had their Tom Yum soup and Spicy Thai Pad Se-ew noodles. Good food and quick. Weird shape to layout, kitchen right by the front door and servers and customers cramped into small waiting space. Overall good.
author: Tom M.

description:
Located in DT SF lies a small and cozy Thai restaurant. A bit small but it was pretty empty during lunch hour on a Saturday so we had no trouble finding seats. I ordered a Thai iced coffee which took forever to get to me. My bf got his Thai tea within a minute though, so I assumed it takes awhile to make Thai coffee. By the time my entree came my drink came shortly after. The workers at first were on their phones giggling over something, thus it took awhile for us to get our orders in. I was a bit cranky and hungry, so it was tiring to get their attention. They were nice however as soon as they picked up on our body language. 

The lunch specials here are worth it! I forgot the pricing, about $10 for a plate of 2 half entrees (you choose from a set list), rice, soup, and appetizer. Pretty decent deal. My bf ordered that and got vegetarian pad thai, chicken, tofu, and tom yum soup. He was surprised at how tasty the vegetarian pad thai turned out and was pleased with his meal (he's a meat eater). The soup was pretty good, I ended up eating all of it. I ordered the pad kee mao with chicken spicy. It resulted in a mild and oily noodles mixed with ground chicken. I prefer regular chicken more so than ground, but the dish overall wasn't that bad. Tasty sauce and I added the vinegar hot peppers from the condiments tray to add some spice to it. I think I enjoyed the tom yum more than my noodles. Towards the bottom of my plate of pad kee mao resided a pool of oil. Not very pleasing, they could at least put lettuce underneath the noodles to hide/absorb the oil.

Overall, a decent Thai restaurant. I recommend the lunch special since you're getting tons of food for a decent price.
author: Rita K.

description: Delicious and reasonably priced. Really nice to find a restaurant downtown that doesn't cost a lot and was so tasty. We had a party of 7 and were seated quickly. Everyone loved their food.
author: L B.

description:
The curry was so spicy it was inedible. I understand we are from out of town, but when I mentioned it the very rude waitress just took our plates away (hardly touched) and pretty much blamed it on me for ordering the "medium" spicy curry.  
The spring rolls where good. The service was horrible we left hungry. They could give a shit if you stay or go, or happy or not. There's a million places to eat in this area, go somewhere else.
author: Ashley H.

description: This is my first time in SF and this place is a great place to grab lunch if you're at a conference in the area. The food was wonderful, the prices were reasonable, but the service was terrible..... We waited 45 minutes for a simple dish and took 15 minutes to get the check. Don't come here if in a hurry!! Overall, great food with below par service.
author: Rachel N.

description:
I was torn between a 4 and a 5 for this one and I'll tell you why.

I wanted to order the Gang Pak, but the hostess said it only came in 'medium' spice.  I asked if they could make the Penang Curry a little milder, but that also came in medium or spicier.  She recommended a different dish that would have been too sweet...so I took a risk and got the Penang with tofu.  That's truly the only thing that was wrong with this experience.  Considering that this is Thai food, and surely they wanted to make it authentic, I can let that one slide.  At least they gave me a heads up!

I will say that the food tasted absolutely delightful. Broccoli, carrots, cabbage, red and green peppers.  Sticky rice that wasn't too sticky.  The spice was a lot for me, but not unbearable.  I was still fully able to enjoy the flavor of the dish.  It was just under 10 dollars as well!  Highly recommended.
author: Carissa L.

description:
Great service. Food came out fast which was great because I was starving. This is the 3rd day in a row I've come here and the food is great and consistently great quality.

I recommend for sure!!
author: Jimmy A.

description: Good tasty Thai food in Union Sq. Prices a reasonably cheap so you can order a few dishes and eat like queen/king! Would recommend this place for good food at a bargain. Won't be disappointed. 2nd time back for me.
author: Frances I.

description: We ate here a few days ago while staying at a hotel around the corner. Even though they were busy, they got us in quickly. Food was reasonably priced, service was good, and food was tasty.
author: Ryan M.

description:
This is a pretty good Thai restaurant in the Tenderloin/Union Square area.  People watching from this restaurant is quite interesting.

The duck fried rice here is one of the best I have had.  When Thai fried rice is done well, it's really good.  The portion size was very respectable for two people.

The golden pouches are an appetizer that are basically glorified samosas.  There is a skin that is deep fried and inside are potatoes and the like.  These were pretty good, the first time I've had a Thai samosa.

The tom yum soup was a little bit disappointing or maybe I just don't like Tom Yum soup?  The soup boat was very large for two people but I thought the soup was a bit sour.  I would have liked the broth to be less clear since usually the opaque Thai soups taste the best.  The contents of the soup were mediocre as well, especially the chicken as it was a bit dry.

Service was fine.  The total of the meal was a little more expensive than I would have liked ($30-$35 or so) but the food is good.
author: Danielle C.

description:
Right around the corner from my hotel, so it is easy to get to. 

The scents of the food are delicious, The quickness of the service is incredible, even at 8pm on a Friday night. And the FOOD!  The food was really, really good!

The husband ordered a curry and I ordered the Garlic Pepper pork. Oh.. WOW. IT was all good, it left me craving it again. I know that before I leave, I'll eat at Old Siam again!
author: Dianna B.

description: Delicious food, cozy corner location, excellent service at a great price!  Loved the lunch special which includes rice, pad thai and appetizer with your entree choice.  Will definitely be back, tomorrow....as a matter of fact!
author: Dina E.

description:
Piecewise rating.
Service: 2 1/2
Food: 2 2/3
Amount for price: 4

Bottom line: 2 3/4 or 2 4/5. I really wanted to still give this place a 3, but thinking about our overall experience, I just can't. If I'm with friends and they're really set on going here, I might politely follow along. But don't count on seeing me here by my own accord.

= Amount for price: 4 =
This is too much food for ten bucks. Four of us each got the dinner special for $9.95. You choose an appetizer + entree, and fried rice & pad thai are included as part of the deal. All four items come on a single plate. I wouldn't exactly say that any of us were big eaters, which I think you'd have to be (or almost be) to finish the food.

= Food: 2 2/3 =
I ordered the chive cake appetizer for our table on a hunch it might be a Thai interpretation of pajeon (Korean green onion pancake). Turns out it kind of was. Instead of being a pancake, it came as four patty cakes. Biting through the crisp exterior revealed a moist, gel-like cave populated by coarsely cut chives (as opposed to the smaller bits in commonplace pajeon). Before I'd said anything, my three Korean friends compared it to pajeon too.

Aside from the default fried rice and pad thai, our combo plates included shrimp rolls, fried tofu, BBQ pork, fried chicken cutlets (think katsu), tofu pra ram, and red curry (described by our waitress as the spiciest kind). Everyone said the food was passable, with one lasting exception. One of my friends who hadn't gotten the curry tasted it; "shampoo" was his chosen word to describe the flavor.

Repulsed yet intrigued, I had to try some too. While there definitely was a curry presence, I could see what he was talking about. Though still less than pleasant, it wasn't as jacknasty as I was expecting. Among shampoos, I'd group it in with Nexxus or Aussie rather than Nizoral or T/Gel. Even so, shampoo is for your hair, not your mouth. To top things off, it wasn't even spicy shampoo like we'd been warned / promised - the heat level was definitely trumped up. You're reading this from a spice weakling to boot. Oh, and the person whose dish it was? He endured teasing from the other two through the remainder of the meal.

A final bit regarding my friend's analogy: the guy's an ESL student. You know his textbook contains eloquence absent from everyday American speech. So I think it says something that, of all his chapters of vocabulary and clunky translations from the electronic dictionary, he coined "shampoo" as the descriptor for this curry. He doesn't eat shampoo. We asked.

= Service: 2 1/2 =
After ordering, it was something like 15 minutes before we got our appetizer. Another 10 to 15 minutes elapsed before we had our main plates. It was a Thursday early evening with the place about half full and only two or three tables placing orders.

I'm sure not all the waitresses are like the main one we had. Ours was curt to the point of often walking away before we were done answering or making requests. I don't think it was a language thing; even people who aren't adroit in English can still listen or at least be present as you're speaking. I didn't get the impression that she was mean-spirited, just too abbreviated.

Case in point: in our last verbal interaction with her, I instinctively used two hands to separately point at my noodles and rice as I asked to get a box for my rice and... and that's as far as I got before the plate was out of my hands and heading to the register counter. I watched from my seat, unsure what she'd do with her incomplete instructions. She got a box and scraped the pad thai into it. Okay, that's good. She next picked up the plate and scraped the fried rice into a waste basin. So much for having leftovers later. But I'm not trippin'.

Of the other waitresses, I kept thinking I'd seen two of them working at other restaurants.
author: Dan B.

description: This is my favorite restaurant! The food is affordable, delicious and they serve large helpings! The staff is also very friendly! I loved the Pad See Ew, I will definitely be going back soon!
author: Joseph K.

description: This place is so good ! We came here after  kin lhao. At the other Thai restaurant the price was expensive and the portion was small so we decided to this place across the street and pleasantly surprised by the quality the food. It is much cheaper compare to kin lhao ans it is probably one of the few thai place I will come back!
author: Shuang C.

description:
We are visiting San Francisco for the New Year weekend and my husband loves Thai food and this place is right across from our hotel, so we thought we would try it.  The food was very typical Thai and tasted like many other Thai restaurants we have been to; however,  the service was HORRIBLE!! 
It's super slow and the waitresses are rude and inconsiderate.  They just put the food on the table with no regard to who ordered what.  They put the beer my husband ordered in front of my 13 year old daughter!  They also don't clean up your table.  We ordered appetizers and they didn't bother to clean those plates up before serving our dinner.  Our table was overflowing with dirty plates throughout our entire meal. 
They also brought us the check without asking if there was anything else we wanted. We wanted to try the ice cream and had to explain to them we weren't done yet. 
The list goes on and on!  
Honestly, the food was not that good to put up with the service.  Sometimes you have such an amazing meal you don't care,  but in this case, the service was so bad it didn't allow us to enjoy our meal.
author: Kelly C.

description:
Okay food. Good price. An entree with wine for less than $17 is really good for downtown San Francisco. We had the sweet chicken, some types of mango rice stir fry, and the special noodle. Over all I got filled up, not definitely not like "omigah dis is guuuuud" if you know what I mean. Their portion is smaller than elsewhere, which is fine with me anyway since that's perfect portion control. However if you want bigger portion you can order it a la carte, just keep in mind that it wouldn't be served with rice or anything else. 
The three stars were for service. We didn't get served very well. I tried to wave down the waitress to order extra food and it took me forever for one to stop by. Keep in mind this is a relatively small diner and it wasn't anything near busy when I came. Even more so, the waitresses seemed more interesting in chatting with each other at the bar than actually serving
author: Mai K.

description:
The price is not reasonable, high price but small amount of food. The bad thing is on their receipt, they charged gratuity by 20% automatically and  when pay by credit card, they replaced the detailed receipt with a new one which only shows the total price and let you give more tips. Be careful! They rely  on cheating

Btw, I ordered Crab roll, but actually the roll is almost vegetarian roll, where is the crab meat?! So bad!
author: Honghao Z.

description:
My friends and I were starving and it's right next to h&m!

I promptly ordered the Pad See Ew because it's one of my favorite Thai dishes and I was ready to grub. It tastes good and it's a great portion for the price

There was hardly any wait and the waitresses were friendly. It's tasty and affordable!
author: Audrey C.

description: Pad thai on special was not pas Thai. Watery Panang curry and the fried rice was pretty tasteless. Very below average, expected more from Thai.
author: Kalil M.

description: First time here for lunch and I had the thai green curry (with pork) over rice. Color could have been greener, other than that it was full of flavor. Enjoyed the condiment rack... like my spices!
author: Brandon Y.

description: Walked in there last night because we were hungry and the other place was all full.The food is fine but the service is honestly terrible.The waitresses basically threw the food at us. Dont go in there if you cant tolarate bad service.
author: Lara Ç.

description: I am a huge fan of REAL THAI food. They have spicy that meets tasty - prim khing is my favorite and not only do they have it, it is delicious!!! Don't  miss even though it seems to be a hole in the wall mom and pops are the best! Totally authentic!
author: Jenn N.

description: Had a stuffy nose and a scratchy throat. I was looking for a spicy soup and found the  Tom Yum Gai soup. It's was spicy and hot and sour. It definitely helped! The mushrooms were the best part. Service was average. And they weren't very busy. Will come again.
author: Sarah B.

description: It was pretty good.  I had the lunch special with Tom Yum soap (nice and spicy), and the chicken satay with Panang curry.  Not the best peanut sauce or Panang that I've ever had, but good.  And large portions to fill you up.  And just down the street from the Hotel Nikko.
author: Alan K.

description: Food was fine, service was ok. Tables are a little close to each other. Felt like I was eating with strangers.  We requested a different table and they accommodated us. Felt like the prices where very fair. Not free and not a joke. My wife really enjoyed the coconut juice drink. I would go again on our next trip if I had a taste for thai as its super close to the hotel we typically stay in every year.
author: Eric L.

description: Not good, not even a little. Feels like your in a cheap buffet. Very generic taste. Save your money and find a more authentic restaurant in the area
author: Frank C.

description: Not much to look at from outside but as you walk in and pass the kitchen and see Thai folks only speaking Thai--you know it will be good. The peanut sauce is the best I have ever had, and topped onto the crab rolls it's simply amazing. The pad Thai was good, but the soup was the best.
author: Scott K.

description: This is my absolute favorite Thai restaurant in San Francisco! The food is soo amazing!! From the pad Thai to the wonderful selection of curries I just can't get enough! It's more of a hole in the wall compared to nicer restaurants where I'm from so I wouldn't recommend it for special occasions but a quick and delightful lunch or dinner or takeout it is a great go-to! Use code:              eats-aleishat35ue and get $10 off ubereats app on first order! Very quick and great customer service when needed!!
author: Aleisha T.

description: Very tasty and potentially the most affordable place to eat downtown...
author: Mr N.

description:
Went there with a couple of friends without planning, this place is great!

Menu is well priced, food is decent and semi authentic, and the wait time for food wasn't very long.

We ordered the coconut soup, pineapple fried rice, pad thai, combination porang chicken and red curry vegetarian dish with rice noodles (I had  it switched from rice). 

The coconuit soup was really good, it was flavorful and tasty. The pineapple fried rice was a must order. There were a lot of meat and pineapple, and the rice had great curry flavor. I couldn't stop eating it! The red curry vegetarian with rice noodle dish is another must order. I mixed the rice noodles inside the curry bowl and ate it like noodle soup. Tasted great, and I liked the rich coconut flavor. My least favorite was the pad thai, it wasn't bad, tasted alright, but was a little too sour + sweet. Don't get me wrong, it wasn't bad though! If you like that strong sour + sweet, then you should probably give it a try. The combination dish with porang chicken was average but well portioned. 

Overall, the price was good for the portion and food was alright. Service wasn't outstanding but if you do pass by this place, do give it a try!
author: Janice L.

description: Nice old fashioned Thai restaurant. Great flavor and portion size. Try the lunch specials. The shrimp roll is very tasty like egg roll with shrimp in every bite. May want to order more. Must visit again.
author: Classi S.

description: This place is bad. The food is bland and utterly flavorless. The service, while polite, was anything but efficient. One of our two meals was downright awful; asked to have it removed from our bill to which our waitress replied "but that's what you ordered." WTF? Had she bothered to check-on us during our meal perhaps we could have resolved the situation to everyone's liking. Didn't happen! Unequivocally, this was the worst dining experience to-date in SF. Go elsewhere. This place is a hole.
author: Christopher K.

description:
Tried this place while visiting on business, mostly because it was close and rated pretty well.  The reviews were right.

The Thai Pad Se-ew with chicken was fantastic although I would have preferred a level up on spice.  Highly recommended.
author: Ryan A.

description:
I came to this restaurant with a few friends. It was raining outside and the prices in this place seemed great. I ordered the Massaman curry with pork rib and rice. The dish was good, but there was not enough rice.
The reason I am giving this place a poor review is due to the service. Throughout the entire hour we spent there the waitress never refilled my glass of water. It wasn't a matter of lack of service to the table, since everyone received adequate hydration. It wasn't a matter of the waitress not knowing, since I motion and asked each time she passed by. My friend took my glass to make sure, and she offered to refill it. After such poor service they forced a 18% gratuity on me. Ridiculous.
author: Tai T.

description: I took a chance and went here with some guests from out of town who were staying at a nearby hotel. Yelp reviews seemed ok so we went in. We were all hungry and looking for some good and tasty Thai food. We were very disappointed. The food was very average and some of the dishes so oily we could not eat it. Sorry but will not go here again if I can help it.
author: Kevin C.

description: The food was 5*. The service was a 1*... collectively- I'm giving the benefit of the doubt that I went on an off night. I work in the industry. Took 10 minutes for server to take drink & food order. One entree took 15 minutes after everyone else's food. We only saw the server once, and then the busser (or perhaps another server) just asked us if we "wanted to pay now " so we did and went to another bar for drinks. Maybe get take out? Also the garlic shrimp- shell was on, and it overpowers you with garlic. Just avoid it.
author: Vincent M.

description: I've been here twice with my bf, and the food is great but both of the time we came here, the service really sucked. It took forever to place our order because they didn't pay attention to us, and on top of that, they gave us our food without any utensils. I just wish they had better service
author: Elaine C.

description:
I usually eat lunch here when I have to visit one of my offices a few blocks away.  It is by far not the best Thai food out there but, it is a good spot to get get your Thai food fix.  They get the food out to you pretty quick, especially if you order their lunch specials, which includes a choice off app, entree, and comes with fried rice and veggie pad thai, all for about $12 or so.  You can get a cup of soup for an additional $2 something, not bad but their tom kha kai soup is a little watery but still flavorful.

The service is pretty efficient, as they've always managed to keep my water glass full.  But when they get busy, they get busy.  Also, no matter what time of year it is, if the resto is at least half full, it'll get hot in there way quick.

Overall, it's a good spot.  I've eaten here countless times and will continue to do so!

#ThaiLunchInTheTLoin
author: Nick D.

description: Randomly found this restaurant while walking in the city. The food was very good and reasonably priced.
author: Aaron A.

description:
Decently priced and pretty tasty Thai food for that quick lunch during the work week! My team came here for a group lunch and even though we didn't have a reservation for a group of 9, seating was quickly arranged and we were happily accommodated. It helped that we showed up about 20 minutes before the noon lunch rush started, it was pretty busy and packed when we left.

The appetizers we ordered for the table came out late, after everyone received their entree. That was a bit frustrating, as we were mostly all full by then, but we ate most of it anyway.

There were some dish options that I hadn't seen at other Thai places and I was very happy with the chile sauce tofu and rice dish I ordered. The menu has no indication of the heat levels of the dishes though so be warned if you're sensitive to heat. 

There's a fair number of options for the vegetarians/vegans, not as much as I've seen at other restaurants, but you won't be struggling to find something to your taste.
author: Cassandra J.

description:
Great food, nice location, simple/classic ambience, reasonable prices. I had the vegetarian spring rolls (excellent) and chicken pad thai (sans tofu) (good). I was going to try the mango sticky rice, but I was so full! I'll have to go back one night this week for dessert... I highly recommend popping in if you're nearby.

The doorway IS a little awkward, but nothing TOO untoward.
author: Anne K.

description: Everything was good.  We had the fried trout, pad thai, egg rolls, pineapple fried rice, and a mild yellow curry of scallops and prawns with avocado and mango.  The latter gave us a chance to try something different.  Right by Hilton.  Gets busy.  Plenty of local patrons.
author: Soc G.

description: Easily located. Well greeted by the staff upon enter the restaurant. They served nice Tom Yum soup and fried rice. The portion of food is big. Good enough for sharing.
author: Desmond L.

description:
i was really hoping to go to the acclaimed Kin Khao across the street but it was closed for a private event and when I walked out I saw this place.

Ok kind of looks like a hole in the wall but its actually nice inside and it was busy. A good sign when the place has 8 tables already going at 5 pm.

I had the special which is served until 6pm if I recall correctly.

The Tom Yum soup was good and was a variant of my usual expectation with more veggies than usual and it did have heat kicking around.

The Chicken in Yellow Curry was generous and the sauce did have a curry bend to it. It was creamy. The fried rice mound and veggies were fine.

i was surprised by the fried rice as a side as opposed to steamed but hey the chef decides how to cook.

It was a good meal and ask for the tray of sauces to add any of them to your meal as the dish is kind of made safe with less spice than I would expect.
author: Johnny L.

description: Love this place.  Have had several pre-theater meals here with groups of friends, between 6 and 10 of us at different meals.  Everything we've ordered has been delicious, delivered quickly.  Very friendly service staff.  And fairly inexpensive to boot.  They have a lot of rice and noodle dishes for around $10, with special dishes a little higher.
author: David K.

description: They used to be so good, but lately they have been getting worst and worst. Until Finally I am ready to write this review. I used to come in frequently and order Shrimp Pad Thai and the last time the were little tiny shrimps, the kind that you probably garnish a fish dish with and there were only 5 of those. The noodles were old and stuck together as one lump. Sorry, But that is the last time I visit this restaurant. Time to find a new one.
author: Steven B.

description:
**Deceptive Management 
**Inconsistent service and food quality 
**Incompetent/Illiterate Staff
**No business sense; Horrific business practices 
**Thrives on out-of-town tourists/visitors, NOT locals who know how to commute beyond the mega hotels

I stick by my critique of them being the Jack In The Box of Thai food.  With my most recent experience, I'd say the mall versions BEAT THEM hands down! 

Learning from my lesson the first time around, I kept my order simple.  I ordered a 'Fresh roll' and requested it be made vegetarian.  On a previous occasion, the waitress was fluent and really competent.  She made certain I knew the difference between an egg roll and spring roll'; "Fresh Roll".  I did and thanked her for being so clear and taking extra initiatives to make certain.  I got what I ordered without flaw.  On that note, I returned the following week to order the same.

This time, I was greeted by an illiterate waitress that couldn't tell the different between their wine menu and general menu.  Had to reiterate, 'Give me the menu.'  Then, I ordered THE SAME ITEM, plus a 'Veggie (egg) Roll'.  I specifically said "Make them both vegetarian."  "Huh?"  Was her frequent response; repetition of my orders and anything out of my mouth was necessary.  

If someone can BARELY SPEAK no less UNDERSTAND ENGLISH, SEND THEIR BUTT TO WORK IN THE BACK, NOT UPFRONT WITH CUSTOMERS!!! ITS A SAFE ASSUMPTION THAT A SMALL PERCENTAGE OF CUSTOMERS ARE GOING TO BE/SPEAK THAI WHEN DINING IN A THAI RESTAURANT!!!

Having faith that things went well last week, I paid and walked out.  Midway through the Fresh Rolls, I saw pieces of shrimp tucked away.  HOLY CRAP!!!  I rushed back with the receipt and demanded to see the Manager.  Manger had the audacity to accuse me of NOT specifying I wanted vegetarian. HOW MUCH MORE CLEARER DO I HAVE TO BE WHEN I SAY "MAKE THEM BOTH VEGETARIAN"??!!??!!  I then put her on the spot and informed her I ordered the same last week without issue.  "Oh, ok.  I'm so sorry. Do you want us to make another one or do you want your money back?"  Poison me again?!?!?!?! Over a simple order that you can do right one week but not the other?!?!?!?!?!  I can get the same thing without error at the Metreon!!!!!!!!  "Give me my money back!!!!!!!!!"

WHAT IS IT WITH THESE DAMN PEASANTS?!?!?! There's nothing wrong with being a mom-and-pop operation or being locally-based/run.  I've eaten at many places that are just the same.  The difference between the good and the horrible ones is when someone screws up, they acknowledge it, apologize, and offer to rectify the problem without cost to the customer.  These PRICKS, LIKE MANY DIVEY RESTAURANTS OWNED/OPERATED BY PEOPLE WHO WOULD BE BETTER OFF AS JANITORS, OPTED TOWARD DENYING WRONG-DOING OR BLAMING THE CUSTOMER UNTIL THEY GET CAUGHT RED HANDED!

Upon a 3rd look at my receipt, I noticed they spelled 'vegetarian' as "vegearian".  WTF?!?!?!?!?!?!  

Save your money, your time, your stomach/kidneys and a potential trip to the ER.  AVOID AT ALL COSTS!!!!!
author: Honest J.

description: Very good food for a very good price.  I recommend this place for anyone looking for an affordable sit down place in union square.  My partner and I go here when we're doing errands downtown or going to the movies.
author: Rob M.

description: Went there for dinner since the other Thai restaurant close by was packed. I had their chicken satay and I have to say, it was pretty good. The service was efficient as well. It was just across the street for the Hilton I was staying/working at, so I wanted something quick which worked out great.
author: Bob K.

description:
Great food for a small cost! Pad-se-ew was delish along with the garlic fish and Tom Yum soup!! It got busy really fast on a Friday even in around 6pm. 

Servers were prompt and friendly :)
author: Tifany Q.

description:
My favorite siam thai in the city, yes it is somewhat overpriced but the siam delight curry is heavenly. I absolutely adore their customer service. I am a regular to-go person, but sometimes i do prefer to sit in to eat. Also, i enjoy the atmosphere of this restaurant.

They also have lunch specials, but I am not a fan of them because the food seems pre-made , but the portions are good.
author: Bai Z.

description: Just had a really good family meal at the Old Siam. We're holidaying in SF and fancied a Thai meal and this place was close to our hotel.  It had a few mixed reviews but we received great, prompt service, great food and both the beer and the wine was better than most other places.  In terms of value for money, difficult to beat this in the centre of SF.
author: Naz S.

description: Great food ! Typical downtown SF not so great location buy, if you are a local native like me you will enjoy this authentic cuisine.
author: Sunny B.

description: Nothing fancy on the outside, but warm, clean and friendly service inside.  We were pleasantly surprised at the presentation and quality of the dishes for the money.  Service was prompt and with a smile!  A good portion of food for the lunch specials!  Wish you the same experience I had here!
author: Chuckster S.

description: I would give this a 10 star!! Food is super authentic and very delish. Between the 6 of us, we shared the pad thai, beef salad, papaya salad and beef larb...all with a side of sticky rice. And you must have your dinner with a cold, refreshing thai tea w milk. The only thing I wouldn't order again is the papaya salad and beef salad because it was too sweet for me - flavor of the dishes is still good though - that's just my preference. When and if I get the opportunity to go back to sf, I would have to do the pad thai and beef salad with sticky rice and thai tea!
author: Maiyiv T.

description:
The Old Siam Thai Restaurant  is between my home and job. I always wanted to try , today 10/4/2014 , I finally tried. I am really sorry , i dont want to be rude. But this is the worst Pad Thai until now. I paid $10 . The noodle has no taste , a half doesnt  even have sauce , it was white. I counted 2 tofu 3 shrimps. If i wasnt tired, i definitely go back there and get my money back....
First and last I ate there.
And people are not really welcoming either
author: Nebahat S.

description: The lamb curry was excellent!!! Tender, flavorful, and without any gamey taste or smell. Service was a bit slow but the waitress was so sweet and bubbly that she made the dining experience great.
author: Vera Marie J.

description: Convenient to my hotel as it is right across the street.  Service was quick the lunch special was a good deal a little pad Thai a little rice, main dish and shrimp rolls   The only thing I didn't like is the beggars outside the door as go in and out. Will definitely go back when I need a Thai fix
author: Chris B.

description:
This review is long dew. I have been a loyal customer of old siam. I have tried their soups, salads, appetizers, curries and noodles. It's my go to restaurant for a quick bite. I am a big fan of their mango ice cream.
Service: Is very nice and quick. The waitresses are quite nice. 
Food: Fresh rolls and fried calamari are my favorite appetizers. Love their Salmon Panang curry and garlic fish. Seafood noodle soup is another one of my favorite items. 
Ambiance: it is a well lit place and the ambiance is fairly like a good average priced restaurant

Overall. I love old siam. I have been there about 20-30 times and never been dis satisfied .
author: Kirandeep K.

description: Downtown for a conference and tried to get in the famous Khin Kao, but it had just closed. found old Siam across the street. It appeared to be a grungy hole in the wall on the outside but inside it's nice clean and plenty of people.  authentic Thai curry with seafood and told the waiter. He suggested a Penang curry dish. 2 small shrimp, 2 mussels, 2 calamari, and a half dozen baby scallops w/ vegetables. At $12.95 it was a bit pricey for a lunch portion but the taste was very good! Of course it was probably much cheaper than Khin Kao across street. Nice window she provided ideal people watching location at 2 o'clock in the afternoon
author: Scott S.

description:
After a long night of shopping and crowds, we found Old Siam. The prices looked decent and place was packed, we thought 'it must be really good'. We weren't wrong, but we weren't right either. 

The portions were small (for what I'm used to) and for the price, I expected a lot more. The dishes were decent, though I can skip on the garlic fish (as I've been spoiled with the delicious garlic fish at Sala Thai in Fremont). Service was whatever -- they refilled our water, got us what we asked for although we had to ask several times for it. Waitresses seemed like they didn't like their job, which made us feel uncomfortable.

Meh.
author: Kim N.

description: The food tasted great and it had a lot of flavor. I enjoyed my duck platter and the waitresses were friendly. I would come back here to this place if given the opportunity to travel here again.
author: Keitha G.

description:
A good place to eat.  Not the best Thai ever, but for the money, it's a definite "goto" place...

Friendly staff - laid back attitude.  They have a special that ends I believe at 7:00 - or maybe it was 6:30... about $11 bucks for a ton of food.  I had the Panang Chicken Curry, and Spring Rolls.  It comes with Pad Thai Noodles and rice... A huge meal for the $11 bucks. 

Nice location, small place with a good atmosphere.  I'm a Thai snob, so don't take the 3 star rating as any sort of bad sign...  If I was going to complain I would say the meal was just a bit greasy/sticky for my taste.  Again, this was better than 90% of the places I have been.

Good Wine prices too.
author: Brad H.

description: We came there with six persons. The meal was very good. Service was very polite and conscious. Thumbs up!
author: Thomas W.

description:
This review is just for lunch - 

A great deal for solid Thai food. The Thai restaurants around Union Square do not offer lunch specials, so this place stands out. 

For under $11, the lunch special (which goes until quite late in the day) includes a small appetizer, your choice of entree - from curries, to sautees, to grilled chicken - pad thai, and egg fried rice. For an extra $2.50 you can add a small bowl of soup. 

I'm definitely going to come back to try other combinations and noodle soups. Old Siam is a go-to lunch spot in the area.
author: NickJess S.

description: What a wasted appetite! Food was tasteless; the restaurant smelled bad, could not place the smell. It is a disgrace to the fine name of Thai food. Would not recommend it unless you are dying of hunger and there is nothing else available to eat.
author: Ramesh K.

description:
Really nice choice for Thai food in the Union Square area.  Close walk from the Hilton, all three entrees in our group were excellent.  Siam Thai Duck was really good (and I don't really like duck).  Pad Seew was very good and dinner portion was generous.  Prices were great considering the quantity and quality.

Place was slammed on a Monday night and service was slow but courteous.
author: Daniel M.

description:
I was in dire need of sustenance as I just completed a 4.3 hour bike ride. I was dazed and in poor condition to become educated and enlighten myself with the tastiest noodle soup around so I walked to the nearest location. 

The restaurant appeared to have promise as it was pretty busy, and very few empty seats were available.

I ordered the BBQ pork with Chinese Broccoli and egg noodle. I requested that it be prepared spicy and the chef executed that request without hesitation. My red, swollen lips are a great indicator.

The soup itself was okay as some of the noodle were clumped together. It was prepared willy nilly. The BBQ pork was delicious but the flavor of he broth was average.

Namaste!
author: MiYun C.

description: It was pouring rain and needed to find the closest restaurant to the Hilton. The food coming out of the kitchen looked delicious. I ordered the lamb curry special and the golden pouch appetizer. The golden pouches were ok. The lamb curry was awful. Also they gave me a carton of cabbage but no rice. The rice would have made the oily curry taste better. I had one bite and nope just couldn't eat it. Oh well - a waste of $20 tonight. Time to find an alternative dinner. The restaurant was packed and I am sorry this was a huge miss for me. Guess I ordered the wrong thing.
author: Bonnie C.

description:
You seriously cannot beat this place for price or quality in Union Square.  I am pretty skeptical about getting good food in busy, touristy areas but this place is a gem.

Went with the cashew chicken and it was outrageous.  Wish I would have tried a curry, but it was a hangover day and I had a lot of stuff to get done.  

Service was great, food came out quick and delicious.  Got to look out a window and people watch.  Whats not to love. 

Oh, and I got out of here for $15.00... FIFTEEN DOLLARS.  FIFTEEN FRIGGEN DOLLARS, and ate like a king.
author: Steve K.

description: tastes amazing, cheaply priced. you can get just about any dish for $10. only down side is that soups and appetizers are also $10(while they should be cheaper than main dishes)
author: POMAH B.

description: Delicious  red curry vegetables  and tofu and vegetable fried rice.  A very solid choice and reasonable prices.
author: Jim H.

description: It's a go-to spot for me and my co-workers for lunch. The food is always prepared perfectly and their delivery service is super fast!
author: Allison M.

description:
Came here in a party of 15 for a friends birthday. They ended up splitting us up into two tables next to each other for groups of 7 and 8. Our table ordered 6 entrees to split amongst the seven of us, it came out to $10 per person after tip and tax. 

I can't remember all of the dishes that we ordered as it's actually been a significant amount of time since I've been there and me actually writing this review. Everything we got though was for the most at least decent, if not exceptional. I selected the panang curry for our table which I thought was excellent. They weren't skimpy on the protein and the curry had great flavor. Wouldn't mind coming back again.
author: Kevin N.

description:
The best Thai restaurant!

I've tried a bunch of others, specifically looking for hot and sour soup.
The Old Siam is the best - the soup is rich both in flavor and ingredients. Right size and amount of hotness ))
Other dishes are good as well. We enjoy going there every time we visit San Francisco.

Way to go, The Old Siam!

PS. Thanks to my friend Luc for showing this place!
author: Eu K.

description:
Craving a plate of Pad See Yew, I decided to head up this place. The outside of this restaurant looks like it's been through the ages, but inside looked rather nice despite the neighborhood and exterior.

Prices aren't too bad given the location. For around 10 bucks, I got myself a plate of noodles big enough for two people to share and keep full until the evening.

Service was standard and nothing really stood out, but seeing as I arrived during the mid afternoon when the lunch rush came to a close and the dinner service was being prepared, I didn't expect to much.

The Pad See Yew was nice and savory and accompanied with some bitter greens similar to broccoli rabe. I'll definitely come back and order this plate again whenever I'm craving and close by.
author: George Z.

description: First Thai ever. Not bad. Very nice staff. Decent selections on their menu. I would definitely recommend and swing by again.
author: J P.

description:
Dinner service on Saturday. Family restaurant. Quick service and quick food to follow. I had coconut chicken soup, hot fresh vegetables, white chicken meat. Fried
Rice cakes with turnip greens. Rice cakes slightly burned,bland. Main dish pork belly with vegetables with hot chili sauce. Pork belly some pieces burned. Two shiva beers. Over all reasonable price. One of the cheaper restaurants for Union/Mission district.
author: Vincent S.

description:
I'm not one for Yelp reviews, but this place frustrated me so I'm writing one. 

I got the beef or pork panang curry for lunch to go. I got the shrimp added which cost extra. The service was quick and friendly. 

When I sat down to ate my food, I didn't have my red meat! It was only shrimp. I feel completely stiffed and since I got takeout I couldn't do anything. 

Other than that, it was filling and tasty for the price. But I'm disappointed.
author: Daniel S.

description: Were originally on our way to the filipino place near by but didn't like the look of it. We noticed this place on the corner which looked nice. We were seated immediately and ordered the lunch specials. For $11.95 you get a choice of app and entree and comes with rice and pad thai. Soup is extra. The Thai milk tea doesn't have boba, though. Overall very good but a little over priced especially for the part of town it's in. Some scary characters up on Ellis street.  Seemed like a good mix of clientele who seemed to enjoy the place.
author: Lee O.

description:
Had take away from  Old Siam Thai restaurant.

I order pumpkin curry with chicken, and based on a Yelp review by Nicha K :
"One of my favorites is "kao soy" -- noodles in curry sauce with chicken, pickled veggies, and red onions--a rare menu item from northern Thailand) that you don't find in many Thai restaurants."

This was an exceptional soup that would likely be a tad too spicy for some, but was just right for me. It was severed with both egg noodles and crisp noodles and some fresh cut vegetables. The soup base was a delicious light brown colored mixture with hints of peanut sauce.

After the soup, the pumpkin curry could not get a fair assessment from my palate.

Prompt service of the take away food and reasonable prices, especially for Thai food and in San Francisco. A solid recommendation.
author: Len S.

description: It was super busy inside. The restaurant is a little smaller than I thought. I ordered the combination fried rice and hot tea. The rice was DELICIOUS. The chicken however was sort of plain, same with the shrimp. It came with squid but i thought there would be more pieces. I got one small piece, probably about 2 inches? The hot tea was really bitter. I also tried the Thai tea, really sweet. Overall, it was good food/ok drinks. But I would go back on rare occasions. It was just too crowded for me.
author: Emily L.

description:
Don't judge this book by its cover.  We actually passed it in search of other options but, not finding anything that looked better on a cold, rainy night we decided that Old Siam seemed to be the lesser of many evils.  It more than delivered.  

Group ordered
author: Jay E.

description: This place is a staple. I think it's been here forever! Always good Thai food here. Convenient if you are at the Hilton or Parc55. It's in the Tenderloin, so be careful. I like that they use a lot of vegetables in their dishes. Very good food.
author: Peter K.

description: Always come here when I want some Thai food. Try the red curries ! Also I really like the pineapple fried rice! Great prices especially during lunch time and take into consideration the area the restaurant is in. The this ice tea isn't bad either!
author: Giselle J.

description: This place is ok.  Service is VERY fast and the servers are really nice.  Vegetarians/Pescatarians try the pumpkin curry its yummy and they give a good amount. Clean (which is important in this area) and menu has a lot for a thai restaurant- good selection of meats, rice, noodle dishes etc.  This place is not for your foodies its for you shoppers/workers hunting for a good quick lunch!
author: Gabbi d.

description: Cheap and cheerful - great portion size, tasty food and value for money. Excellent customer service too - the waitresses helped keep our baby entertained so we could enjoy our meal.
author: Rosa C.

description: great food. great service. never disappointed. the staff is always so friendly and welcoming. myself and my coworkers dine here often. we sometimes order lunch for pickup since the restaurant is just across the street and is usually crowded during lunch hours. I always have to fight the urge to eat here every single day...the food is that good! highly recommended. keep up the great work!
author: Ursula R.

description: After 3 years, and many Thai restaurants later; This is still by far my favorite. What can you not like about well priced, flavorful, authentic delicious food? To top it off they have polite servers and a clean restaurant.
author: T M.

description: We saw this place from our hotel room window so I looked it up on Yelp.  It had fairly good reviews so we decided to give it a try.  Despite the sketchy looking outside, the inside was a typical Thai restaurant and the servers were all friendly.  We were not disappointed!  We had the lunch special, which came with noodles, fried rice, an appetizer, and an entrée for $11.99. We both had the chicken satay and the peanut sauce was delicious.  I had the yellow curry with shruump ($2 more) and my daughter had the Old Siam chicken.  Both were good, but the Old Siam chicken was definitely better - crunchy outside, seasoned perfectly, and tender and moist inside.
author: Amber F.

description:
They are understaffed here and the few servers they do have are pretty rude.  We were done with our meal for a good 20 minutes before we were able to flag her down.  When asking for a to-go container and the check, she didn't even acknowledge that she heard us.
The food was also pretty blah.  This is to Thai food what Panda Express is to Chinese food.
Methinks not.
author: Michele S.

description: Good decent place.  Food was tasty but a little on the salty side for me.  They automatically add on 18% tip, so be careful not to double tip.
author: Thomas W.

description: Had not been here  a couple of years. Went on a Sunday for lunch. Certainly not as hectic as during the week. Servers very friendly. Wife said her tofu pad thai was the best she ever had. Fresh rolls were delicious as was the chicken noodle soup made with wide rice noodles.
author: Joe M.

description: Pretty good spot. The people are very nice, and the pad see ew was really good.  Only complaint is that I asked for a bit spicy but it wasn't spicy at all.  No big deal.  I'll be back.
author: Matt R.

description:
Ordered the Pad Sew Chicken for takeout today for lunch. It was decent but kind of bland; I wish there were more vegetables in it. The noodles tasted fresh and homemade at least. Overall it was nothing worth writing home about. The service I got was fine - they took my card, and cooked the order in a hurry. I think I waited maybe 10 minutes and it was busy too.

Bonus points for having a great takeout container. Rather than the typical cheap plastic, styrofoam, or wax paper like container they had this sexy upscale microwavable hard plastic container. It was awesome. I'm going to reuse it for leftovers in the future. Usually Thai places cheap out on this sort of thing, it was a nice surprise and probably the thing I most remembered. I will be back to try some of the other popular dishes, perhaps I will find something more full flavor and memorable.
author: Chris S.

description:
Well, they certainly spruced this place up. It was the diviest of Thai eateries when they squeezed people in a small hovel next door, but the owner smartly expanded into the corner bar and made this the main dining room. The hovel became the kitchen as it should be. The net result is pretty nice considering it presents the gateway to the Tenderloin.

Prices went up, too, but not unreasonably so. Presentation also got better, but the food remains the same...good, solid Thai dishes...nothing extraordinary but extremely well put-together. Certainly a lot better than a tourist trap like Bangkok Noodles on Powell, and I happen to prefer this place over any number of King of Thai Noodles around town.

I had my usual - the Roast Duck Rice Plate - which they charge a fair price of $8.25. It tastes like a real quacker sacrificed himself for my palate. Jamie W. went for the $7.25 Pad Prik Sod with what looked like chow fun noodles. Tasty stuff. Service is a lot smoother these days as they traded in the older waitresses with newer models ...literally. Here's a case where they made a good thing better. Kudos to Old Siam for a conversion well done.

FOOD - 4 stars...very good, still-bargain-priced Thai
AMBIANCE - 4 stars...a much better space than before...you almost forget you're in the 'Loin...OK, not really
SERVICE - 3.5 stars...sleeker waitresses, not as quick
TOTAL - 4 stars...worth a visit if you're grumbling about the paltry choices around Union Square
author: Ed U.

description: Had dinner here with friends the night before they ran the San Francisco Marathon... More than decent Thai food. I got my standard noodle order of beef pad see ew. I'm a big fan of this flat rice noodle dish at most Thai restaurants I come across. The version at Old Siam was quite good. It came with chinese brocolli which works better than the regular kind. Good amount of beef came with it. Neither the meat nor the noodles were dry... I just can't give it 4 stars... Old Siam really deserves 3.5 stars. My friends liked their orders of pad thai and fried fish with brown rice. Service was decent.
author: Chuck D.

description: I will never go here again.  After over 5 years of ordering from them I figured that they would at least treat me fairly.  They are sooo rude.  They got my order wrong and acted like it was my fault.  Anywhere else they would offer to replace it.  What kind of service is that?? This is not the first time they gave me the wrong order. They have left items out before.  Usually I order for my coworkers so there is a lot of food and I don't get a chance to check it all right away.  Since their service was good I always just let it go.  Now the service has gone down the drain and so has their food.  Their food used to be delicious.  Now it is very greasy and the flavors are not all there.  What's worse is that they raised their prices by $2 to $3 on most of the items.  The quality of the food and the service should have gotten better, not worse.
author: R S.

description:
When in a new place looking for good thai food (any kind of asian food) i tend to look for the fewest non asian faces. 

Don't hate, I'm sure Japanese tourists when looking for a hot dog stand, look for the most white faces :)

This place is good, It's on a corner where there's two thai restaurants to choose from, and I'm glad we chose this one.

Pad Thai was very very tasty. The Waitress was nice and friendly and got us in and out quickly.
author: john W.

description:
The food was just OK!  
We had Tom Kha which seemed watery and not as rich and creamy as others I've had. 
The Duck Fried Rice was lacking the Thai flavors that we know and love and the duck was dry. 
My friend had the Green Curry and it was bland. 

Service could improve... It took almost 10min to get greeted after we sat down. 

This wouldn't be a place I'd recommend to friends visiting the City.
author: Deltrina R.

description: My 2nd time trying Thai food and let me tell you they made me love it all over again, I'm coming back!
author: Adrian C.

description: Mediocre food. Service good. Unless you know Thai food without pictures of menu items do not come here. Even if you I suggest you find another place.
author: M R.

description:
Yum! 
I enjoyed this place. Minus the nonexistent staff. 

Delicious food, I just wish the menu had more options. womp womp. =\
author: Amanda Z.

description: The food was tasty but I couldn't give another star because I felt the plate had too much rice and noodles and not enough vegetables and protein (tofu in this case). Service was friendly and fast.
author: Daniel F.

description:
Just a bad experience. The food and service were not very good. I could forgive the service but gosh, that food was terrible. To make matters worse, it was also pricey.

I can't recommend this place unless you're super duper hungry and looking for something open late night.
author: Paris S.

description:
Just left Old Siam but never actually got to eat.

We were the only table when we arrived and they proceeded to seat, take orders and serve other tables before even taking our orders.  They managed to bring us the bill before 3 of us were even served our food. After 1.5 hours I had to leave and my coworkers brought my lunch back with them and its cold.

Sorry totally messed up on this one.
author: Erica B.

description: Excellent! Second night in a tow for Thai Food. Great food, nice atmosphere. Menu has the expected selection although I would like to see some more variety.
author: Kip H.

description: I had the yellow curry lunch special that came with rice, egg rolls, and some noodles. The service was fast and the portions were large. They do something to the noodles that make it extra tasty. I want to say it's slightly sour-ish but in a good way, not sure what it is but will come back if I'm in the area and want some Thai food.
author: Matthew P.

description:
Food is pretty good here for the price.  My favorites are the Thai iced coffee (you can order this to go, and they'll give you a handy little carrying sleeve with a handle) and the Tom Kha soup (coconut soup with chicken, basil, lemongrass and mushrooms).   My boyfriend loves their spicy dishes.  They have a good range of both spicy and mild options.  I've been happy with everything I've ordered so far.   

Be prepared to wait if you go during the lunch rush.  This is not a good stop if you are in a hurry.  Also, if you go in the winter and get seated at one of the tables in the front, you will get hit with a strong blast of cold air every time someone opens the main door.
author: Sandra J.

description: Arrived from DC last night with my husband and we were famished.  Out the door from our hotel, Parc55 Hilton, was this restaurant. Food was authentic Thai and the staff was warm and friendly.  We ordered fried calamari,  green curry with chicken and Thai tea.  Absolutely delicious.  Thank you, we'll be back again!
author: Angel L.

description: I ordered mango sticky rice and I expected the dessert to taste like food. Unfortunately the dish tasted like dirty. Literally like dirt. Then I started to think that I was eating mango that was covered in feces. That's not a normal thought one should have while eating dessert.
author: Christopher L.

description: Got dinner there with friends, cozy space, well cooked meat with special Siam sauce, rich taste. But the price is a little high.
author: Song G.

description:
(See pics)

Recently came here a couple times back to back. It's always solid Thai food with good service.

The dishes were all flavorful (see all the pictures instead of writing all of them here.)

The second time was a bit of surprise as they have this excellent combo (also see picture for the menu.) For $9.95, you will get an appetizer and an entree, with fried rice AND vegetarian Pad Thai! Add &1.95 for a soup too!
author: T L.

description: I am a huge Thai food fan, but I will never come back to this place. Last night my friend and I were looking for a place to grab some Thai ice tea to go, and we came across Old Siam on our way back to the apartment. The boba in my tea was hard, not flavorful, and tasted old. Also the drink itself was way too sweet and needed more milk. To top it all off, I threw it all up an hour or so after. I don't know what their food is like, but if it's anything like the tea I DO NOT recommend it.
author: Annemarie M.

description:
We stopped in here at 9pm on a Saturday night.  The restaurant didn't look overly busy and we were seated promptly.

Things went downhill from there.  We waited about 20 minutes before leaving without any further acknowledgement from staff.  During that same time, another couple who had been seated just before us had about a 15 minute wait before being acknowledged and their order was taken.  I watched another table get served their food, then get to stare at it for about 5 minutes with no silverware or chopsticks.

We went to Smooth Thai across the street and probably had our food before our order would have been taken at this place.  No thanks.
author: Jen G.

description: Be careful if you're a vegetarian/vegan, the "vegetarian" pad thai tastes really fishy
author: Rae H.

description:
I visited this place twice. The first time was for noodle and it pass my test, because I only get the boat noodle soup at a Thai restaurant. The second time was with with two other people. We prefer quit a bit of food;
1. Combo starters- anything deep fried will taste good. Comes with three dipping sauce that was plus. 
2. Tom Kha Gai: this place have one of the better tom Kha Gai. The broth was perfectly balance of coconut milk and the complementing spices.
3. Pad Kae Mao: very reasonable, not greasy, and taste just fine. Would like a bit of greens though.
4. Spicy Egg Plant: good sauce. Since my dinning mates are not spicy group the chef did a great job accommodating our request.
5. Yellow curry: this is their worst dish. Too much onion and the chicken were dry. The sauce were a bit too sweet for me.
6. Duck Basil: pretty tasty. I order this dish before with the first four dishes, but they told me they were out. That's when I order the yellow curry. A few second later they put this this at my table. Instead of canceling the curry I kept it. I wish I could have taken it back. 

Like many review, the service is pretty sparse. Not assigned wait staff to a table, so orders gets mixed up. All in all the food were good. I would go back here again and order different dish on the menu. They also open late, too.
author: Sou S.

description:
We arrived at the restaurant on thanksgiving.
We starting with the fried tofu, followed by the tom Gai soup, grilled seafood, Thai tea and Rotti with coconut . 
The soup was really good and was variant with my usual expectation. 
The seafood also taste really good.
But as for the dessert, I think it's overcooked and too sweet for me.
Service was standard and nothing stood out but seeing it's thanksgiving, we absolutely thank them.
author: Yi L.

description: We came in for lunch, and were greeted by the waft of sweet smelling pad Thai. Little did I know, that sweetness was in abundance in every dish. We ate the pad Thai and the grilled sliced pork. What's interesting is that everything tastes the same in this restaurant and rather bland. My wife had the pad Thai and that tasted like my sliced pork which resembled the egg noodle soup my kids had. Maybe someone forgot to wash off the wok. At least they offer free condiments on the side - sweet chili, peanuts galore, pickles etc. I guess my advice is to come here only when you are really famished, but avoid like the plague since there are many other taverns close by. Take a walk, don't be lazy.
author: Oscar B.

description: To be honest, the overall experience was pretty exquisite, however, the only reason I was not as satisfied as I could have been is because I ordered a dish that I did not really like. It was called the panang salmon. If you like seafood and strong curry, then this is definitely the dish for you! I also got to try my friends combination fried rice and pad Thai and those were very satisfying on the pallets. One other downside was that they charged for steam rice, which I originally thought would come with my Curry Salmon. (Side note they only charge steam rice for dinner time and also they do not split checks :/ so Gg for groups)
author: TheYumExpert I.

description: I'm always skeptical of new Thai places, but this didn't disappoint. Good sized portions, good service, and good price. Very accommodating for the kids who weren't adventurous in their diets, which is always nice. I especially liked the masaman pork-- mmmmmmm.
author: Erin A.

description: Came here for a recent conference.   Easy walk from moscone.   Excellent service.  Very very good food.  I had a combination seafood dish.  Definitely get the sampler appetizer.   It's really good and unique.  Not scary unique! Lol. Make sure you order rice I think it's separate but like 2$.  We were very full and if there wasn't a billion other restraunts to try we would have eaten there two or three times.
author: Joel R.

description: Really great and really affordable as well. The portions are generous and everything I tried was so delicious!
author: Heather S.

description:
A-Ok!  We walked in on a Saturday evening around 7 and the host seemed a bit puzzled but quickly realized that we were there to eat (go figure).  She said she'll seat us in 3 seconds, and 23 seconds later we were on our way to a table.  
Place offers an intimate seating area and service is quick.  We received our food before the silverware!  The pad thai was decent, however, their were barely 4 little shrimps I could find on/in it.  The panang curry was average and very mild.  The table next to us ordered their nutella fried banana coconut dessert and looked really good. 

This place is very conveniently located in the heart of union square.  Good price and value.
author: Sunny C.

description:
WOW just had the red chicken curry.  They add peanut sauce to this curry!  It taste so freakin good! 

The location is pretty crazy is the only downside.  But if you are on the hunt for crack cocaine and thai food this is your one stop shop.
author: Shawn L.

description: This place has some awesome food however service is horrible!  At 10:30 we were told we had to immediately order because the kitchen was closing.  They close at 11:00.  At 10:40 they were refusing seating and taking to go orders only.  They were more concerned about leaving at 11pm that they were about the service.  So much more concerned two different appetizer plates on two occasions were taken from in front of me.  Both times I had food in my mouth I was not able to say anything.  I noticed the waitress would immediately go to the table and look at the tip amount and say thank you or nothing at all.  This immediately flagged me they were more concerned about the tip than the service so I left them a 91 cent tip.  We had not even left the place and they immediately grabbed the check looking at the tip.  They then proceeded to talk crap about us in their native tongue.  I could tell by the look of displeasure on her face.  The same look she would have seen had she looked at my face when she ripped our food from the table right in front of us.  But since she did not notice, it gave me great pleasure to notice her look of displeasure when she saw the tip.  They say Karma is a B----!  Well I am her brother!  Touche!  Now we are even!
author: K J.

description: Affordable thai food. I've had better. One issue is that the door is always opening and closing, too, letting in cold air and it gets windy. The menu had all the standard thai food options, which my friends appreciated more than the thai place across the street (kin khao)
author: Lucky B.

description:
My friends and I were in Union Square and starving, so we decided to try out The Old Siam Thai Restaurant.

The restaurant itself is not that big. From what I remember, there are probably around 10 tables.  Also, the staff is friendly and the service is fast. We had a couple questions about the dishes, and our waitress answered them with ease. In addition, our food arrived quickly! Food that arrives fast when you're starving is always a plus.

We all ordered our own dishes. My friends ordered Pad Kee Mao, Spicy Pan-Fried Noodle, and Curry. I ordered Thai Pad Se-ew, which is basically stir-fried flat rice noodle with Chinese broccoli, egg, black soy sauce, and beef. The dish was flavorful, and the portion size was good. I'm usually not a fan of Chinese broccoli, but in this dish, the Chinese broccoli didn't even taste like Chinese broccoli. I don't know what they did, but I'm a fan! In addition, there was a good amount of meat in the dish too!

Overall, a good experience. I'm definitely coming back here again when I get the chance!

Pictures: http://bit.ly/eowyFU, http://bit.ly/eHdWH3, http://bit.ly/h1HBuo, http://bit.ly/gfh0g5
author: Katty K.

description: We just got back from Thailand a month ago and have been craving that food. This is it. We have eaten at many Thia food places and this place brings us back. They even had Chang beer!  Very good and very nice servers.
author: Jenn M.

description: Came here for the first time after my aunt insisted on coming here. The food here is delicious and the place is really clean! I had paid more for less tasty Thai food before. Eating some of the dishes here really brings me back to 5th grade, where I went to Bangkok for vacation. To me it's considered Aunthetic? Haha, I'll include a picture below and judge for yourself. I must say that eating the entree with rice is much better than just eating it by itself. ^-^
author: Jen N.

description:
The food was really great, waitress were super-helpful. Also a guy nearby helped to choose the best meals because his wife was from Thailand!
Conclusion: best thai restaurant in town!
author: Vytas R.

description: Very good food and friendly way staff.  We had for lunch, thai chicken wings which were awesome and garlic pork which had great flavor.
author: Ed S.

description:
I really thought about giving this place three stars, but I really enjoyed the food and thai tea.
We had a last minute reservation for 7pm on a Saturday. We were handed the regular menu plus a two sided "specials" menu. One of the sides of the "specials" menu had a great selection (pad thai, panaang curry among them) of a mix of items for about 12 bucks!
